docs.title: RType
docs.text:
A GAME ENGINE THAT ROARS !

RType Client Client side part of the RType project. Entity Component System While not a required part of the project, the Entity Component System (or ECS) is quite important. Flint A custom implementation of the Flint library Network Custom classes handeling all the networking. Server As important as all of the other parts (if not more), the server is the masterchief of the orchestra. ECS Network RType dtoa_impl @brief implements the Grisu2 algorithm for binary to decimal floating-point conversion. impl //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

Code Coverage

file pointer to read from Input adapter for a (caching) istream. wide_string_input_adapter iterator_input_adapter_factory index to the utf8_codes array for the next valid byte number of valid bytes in the utf8_codes array number_unsigned_t @brief SAX interface This class describes the SAX interface used by Each function is called in different situations while the input is parsed. The boolean return value informs the parser whether to continue processing the input. @brief a null value was read Return : whether parsing should proceed @brief a boolean value was read val : boolean value Return : whether parsing should proceed @brief an integer number was read val : integer value Return : whether parsing should proceed @brief an unsigned integer number was read val : unsigned integer value Return : whether parsing should proceed @brief a floating-point number was read val : floating-point value s : raw token value Return : whether parsing should proceed @brief a string value was read val : string value Return : whether parsing should proceed !!! note It is safe to move the passed string value. @brief a binary value was read val : binary value Return : whether parsing should proceed !!! note It is safe to move the passed binary value. @brief the beginning of an object was read elements : number of object elements or -1 if unknown Return : whether parsing should proceed !!! note binary formats may report the number of elements @brief an object key was read val : object key Return : whether parsing should proceed !!! note It is safe to move the passed string. @brief the end of an object was read Return : whether parsing should proceed @brief the beginning of an array was read elements : number of array elements or -1 if unknown Return : whether parsing should proceed !!! note binary formats may report the number of elements @brief the end of an array was read Return : whether parsing should proceed @brief a parse error occurred position : the position in the input where the error occurs last_token : the last read token ex : an exception object describing the error Return : whether parsing should proceed (must return false) @brief SAX implementation to create a JSON value from SAX events This class implements the interface and processes the SAX events to create a JSON value which makes it basically a DOM parser. The structure or hierarchy of the JSON value is managed by the stack ref_stack which contains a pointer to the respective array or object for each recursion depth. After successful parsing, the value that is passed by reference to the constructor contains the parsed value. BasicJsonType : the JSON type json_sax_dom_callback_parser lexer_base //////// //////// lexer @brief lexical analysis This class organizes the lexical analysis during JSON deserialization. cbor_tag_handler_t how to treat CBOR tags binary_reader //////////////// //////////////// @brief deserialization of CBOR, MessagePack, and UBJSON values parse_event_t ///////// ///////// parser @brief syntax analysis This class implements a recursive descent parser. primitive_iterator_t internal_iterator @brief an iterator value !!! note This structure could easily be a union, but MSVC currently does not allow unions members with complex constructors, see https://github.com/nlohmann/json/pull/105. iter_impl @brief a template for a bidirectional iterator for the class This class implements a both iterators (iterator and const_iterator) for the class. !!! note An iterator is called initialized when a pointer to a JSON value has been set (e.g., by a constructor or a copy assignment). If the iterator is default-constructed, it is uninitialized and most methods are undefined. The library uses assertions to detect calls on uninitialized iterators.* @requirement The class satisfies the following concept requirements: - BidirectionalIterator: The iterator that can be moved can be moved in both directions (i.e. incremented and decremented). @since version 1.0.0, simplified in version 2.0.9, change to bidirectional iterators in version 3.0.0 (see https://github.com/nlohmann/json/issues/593) json_reverse_iterator /////////////////// /////////////////// @brief a template for a reverse iterator class Base : the base iterator type to reverse. Valid types are (to create and) (to create The.) class satisfies the following concept requirements: - BidirectionalIterator: The iterator that can be moved can be moved in both directions (i.e. incremented and decremented). - OutputIterator: It is possible to write to the pointed-to element (only if Base is version.) 1.0.0 json_default_base @brief Default base class of the class. So that the correct implementations of the copy / move ctors / assign operators of do not require complex case distinctions (no base class / custom base class used as customization point), always has a base class. By default, this class is used because it is empty and thus has no effect on the behavior of type @brief JSON Pointer defines a string syntax for identifying a specific value within a JSON document docs.text: Name Description BooleanType @brief namespace for Niels Lohmann See : https://github.com/nlohmann @since version 1.0.0 @brief default JSONSerializer template argument This serializer ignores the template arguments and uses ADL (argument-dependent lookup) for serialization. a class to store JSON values See : https://json.nlohmann.me/api/basic_json/ from_json namespace to hold default from_json function to see why this is required: http://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg21/docs/papers/2015/n4381.html to_json namespace to hold default to_json function to see why this is required: http://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg21/docs/papers/2015/n4381.html root @invariant If the ref stack is empty, then the passed value will be the new root. ref_stack stack to model hierarchy of values object_element helper to hold the reference for the next object element errored whether a syntax error occurred allow_exceptions whether to throw exceptions in case of errors ignore_comments input adapter whether comments should be ignored (true) or signaled as errors (false) current the current character next_unget whether the next get() call should just return current position the start position of the current token token_string raw input token string (for error messages) token_buffer buffer for variable-length tokens (numbers, strings) error_message a description of occurred lexer errors decimal_point_char the decimal point m_it associated JSON instance the actual iterator of the associated instance p s : reference token to be converted into an array index Return : integer representation of s Throw : parse_error.106 if an array index begins with '0' Throw : parse_error.109 if an array index begins not with a digit Throw : out_of_range.404 if string s could not be converted to an integer Throw : out_of_range.410 if an array index exceeds size_type number_buffer the output of the serializer a (hopefully) large enough character buffer loc the locale thousands_sep the locale's thousand separator character decimal_point the locale's decimal point character string_buffer string buffer indent_char the indentation character indent_string the indentation string error_handler error_handler how to react on decoding errors Allocator ordered_map: a minimal map-like container that preserves insertion order for use within nlohmann::basic_json array This union combines the different storage types for the JSON value types defined in JSON type string string (stored with pointer to save storage) binary binary (stored with pointer to save storage) boolean boolean number_integer number (integer) number_unsigned number (unsigned integer) number_float number (floating-point) JSON_ASSERT @brief checks the class invariants This function asserts the class invariants. result @} //////////////////// //////////////////// @name object inspection Functions to inspect the type of a JSON value. ptr @} /////////////// /////////////// get a boolean (explicit) get a pointer to the value (object) get a pointer to the value (object) get a pointer to the value (array) get a pointer to the value (array) get a pointer to the value (string) get a pointer to the value (string) get a pointer to the value (boolean) get a pointer to the value (boolean) get a pointer to the value (integer number) get a pointer to the value (integer number) get a pointer to the value (unsigned number) get a pointer to the value (unsigned number) get a pointer to the value (floating-point number) get a pointer to the value (floating-point number) get a pointer to the value (binary) get a pointer to the value (binary) @brief helper function to implement get_ref() This function helps to implement get_ref() without code duplication for const and non-const overloads ThisType : will be deduced as basic_json or const basic_json Throw : type_error.303 if ReferenceType does not match underlying value type of the current JSON m_value /////////////////// /////////////////// the type of the current element the value of the current element m_parent a pointer to a parent value (for debugging purposes) result /////////////////////////////////////// /////////////////////////////////////// @name binary serialization/deserialization support @{ @brief create a CBOR serialization of a given JSON value See : https://json.nlohmann.me/api/basic_json/to_cbor/

docs.text: Name Description operator<=> @brief comparison operator for JSON types Returns an ordering that is similar to Python: - order: null < boolean < number < object < array < string < binary - furthermore, each type is not smaller than itself - discarded values are not comparable - binary is represented as a b"" string in python and directly comparable to a string; however, making a binary array directly comparable with a string would be surprising behavior in a JSON file. @since version 1.0.0 operator!= @brief an internal type for a backed binary type See : docs.title: Functions
docs.text: Name Description replace_substring @brief replace all occurrences of a substring by another string s : the string to manipulate; changed so that all occurrences of f are replaced with t f : the substring to replace with t t : the string to replace f Pre-condition : The search string f must not be empty. This precondition is enforced with an assertion. @since version 2.0.0 escape @brief string escaping as described in RFC 6901 (Sect. unescape @brief string unescaping as described in RFC 6901 (Sect. concat_length //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// to_json ////////// ////////// set_subtype @brief sets the binary subtype See : https://json.nlohmann.me/api/byte_container_with_subtype/set_subtype/ subtype @brief return the binary subtype See : https://json.nlohmann.me/api/byte_container_with_subtype/subtype/ has_subtype @brief return whether the value has a subtype See : https://json.nlohmann.me/api/byte_container_with_subtype/has_subtype/ clear_subtype @brief clears the binary subtype See : https://json.nlohmann.me/api/byte_container_with_subtype/clear_subtype/ hash @brief hash a JSON value The hash function tries to rely on std::hash where possible. Furthermore, the type of the JSON value is taken into account to have different hash values for null, 0, 0U, and false, etc. BasicJsonType : basic_json specialization j : JSON value to hash Return : hash value of j json_sax_dom_parser r : reference to a JSON value that is manipulated while parsing allow_exceptions_ : whether parse errors yield exceptions reset ////////////////// ////////////////// reset token_buffer; current character is beginning of token unget @brief unget current character (read it again on next get) We implement unget by setting variable next_unget to true. add add a character to token_buffer get_number_unsigned ////////////////// ////////////////// return integer value return unsigned integer value get_number_float return floating-point value get_string return current string value (implicitly resets the token; useful only once) get_position ////////////////// ////////////////// return position of last read token get_token_string return the last read token (for errors only). get_error_message return syntax error message skip_bom ////////////////// ////////////////// @brief skip the UTF-8 byte order mark Return : true iff there is no BOM or the correct BOM has been skipped little_endianness @brief determine system byte order Return : true if and only if system's byte order is little endian !!! note from https://stackoverflow.com/a/1001328/266378 key @brief return the key of an object iterator Pre-condition : The iterator is initialized; i.e. m_object != nullptr. value @brief return the value of an iterator Pre-condition : The iterator is initialized; i.e. m_object != nullptr. json_pointer @brief create JSON pointer See : https://json.nlohmann.me/api/json_pointer/json_pointer/ to_string @brief return a string representation of the JSON pointer See : https://json.nlohmann.me/api/json_pointer/to_string/ parent_pointer @brief create a new JSON pointer by appending the right JSON pointer at the end of the left JSON pointer See : https://json.nlohmann.me/api/json_pointer/operator_slash/ @brief create a new JSON pointer by appending the unescaped token at the end of the JSON pointer See : https://json.nlohmann.me/api/json_pointer/operator_slash/ @brief create a new JSON pointer by appending the array-index-token at the end of the JSON pointer See : https://json.nlohmann.me/api/json_pointer/operator_slash/ @brief returns the parent of this JSON pointer See : https://json.nlohmann.me/api/json_pointer/parent_pointer/ pop_back @brief remove last reference token See : https://json.nlohmann.me/api/json_pointer/pop_back/ back @brief return last reference token See : https://json.nlohmann.me/api/json_pointer/back/ push_back @brief append an unescaped token at the end of the reference pointer See : https://json.nlohmann.me/api/json_pointer/push_back/ push_back @brief append an unescaped token at the end of the reference pointer See : https://json.nlohmann.me/api/json_pointer/push_back/ empty @brief return whether pointer points to the root document See : https://json.nlohmann.me/api/json_pointer/empty/ get_and_create @brief create and return a reference to the pointed to value @complexity Linear in the number of reference tokens. get_unchecked @brief return a reference to the pointed to value !!! note This version does not throw if a value is not present, but tries to create nested values instead. For instance, calling this function with pointer "/this/that" on a null value is equivalent to calling operator[]("this").operator[]("that") on that value, effectively changing the null value to an object. ptr : a JSON value Return : reference to the JSON value pointed to by the JSON pointer @complexity Linear in the length of the JSON pointer. docs.title: array
docs.text:
array_t* array

///////////////////// ///////////////////// @brief a JSON value

The actual storage for a JSON value of the class. This union combines the different storage types for the JSON value types defined in JSON type | value_t type | used type --------- | --------------- | ------------------------ object | object | pointer to array | array | pointer to string | string | pointer to boolean | boolean | number | number_integer | number | number_unsigned | number | number_float | binary | binary | pointer to null | null | no value is stored

Note

Variable-length types (objects, arrays, and strings) are stored as pointers. The size of the union should not exceed 64 bits if the default value types are used.

@since version 1.0.0 object (stored with pointer to save storage) array (stored with pointer to save storage)

docs.title: JSON_ASSERT
docs.text:
const noexcept { JSON_ASSERT

@brief checks the class invariants

This function asserts the class invariants. It needs to be called at the end of every constructor to make sure that created objects respect the invariant. Furthermore, it has to be called each time the type of a JSON value is changed, because the invariant expresses a relationship between m_type and m_value.

Furthermore, the parent relation is checked for arrays and objects: If check_parents true and the value is an array or object, then the container's elements must have the current value as parent.

check_parents whether the parent relation should be checked. The value is true by default and should only be set to false during destruction of objects when the invariant does not need to hold.

docs.title: operator<=>
docs.text:
inline std::partial_ordering operator<=>(const value_t lhs, const value_t rhs) noexcept // *NOPAD*

@brief comparison operator for JSON types

Returns an ordering that is similar to Python: - order: null < boolean < number < object < array < string < binary - furthermore, each type is not smaller than itself - discarded values are not comparable - binary is represented as a b"" string in python and directly comparable to a string; however, making a binary array directly comparable with a string would be surprising behavior in a JSON file.

@since version 1.0.0

docs.title: unget
docs.text:
void unget()

@brief unget current character (read it again on next get)

We implement unget by setting variable next_unget to true. The input is not changed - we just simulate ungetting by modifying chars_read_total, chars_read_current_line, and token_string. The next call to get() will behave as if the unget character is read again.

docs.title: get_unchecked
docs.text:
template<typename BasicJsonType> BasicJsonType& get_unchecked(BasicJsonType* ptr) const

@brief return a reference to the pointed to value

Note

This version does not throw if a value is not present, but tries to create nested values instead. For instance, calling this function with pointer "/this/that" on a null value is equivalent to calling operator[]("this").operator[]("that") on that value, effectively changing the null value to an object.

ptr a JSON value Return reference to the JSON value pointed to by the JSON pointer

@complexity Linear in the length of the JSON pointer.

Throw parse_error.106 if an array index begins with '0' Throw parse_error.109 if an array index was not a number Throw out_of_range.404 if the JSON pointer can not be resolved

docs.title: to_chars
docs.text:
template<typename FloatType> * to_chars(char* first, const char* last, FloatType value)

@brief generates a decimal representation of the floating-point number value in [first, last).

The format of the resulting decimal representation is similar to printf's %g format. Returns an iterator pointing past-the-end of the decimal representation.

Note

The input number must be finite, i.e. NaN's and Inf's are not supported.

Note

The buffer must be large enough.

Note

The result is NOT null-terminated.

docs.title: decode
docs.text:
static std::uint8_t decode(std::uint8_t& state, std::uint32_t& codep, const std::uint8_t byte) noexcept

@brief check whether a string is UTF-8 encoded

The function checks each byte of a string whether it is UTF-8 encoded. The result of the check is stored in the state parameter. The function must be called initially with state 0 (accept). State 1 means the string must be rejected, because the current byte is not allowed. If the string is completely processed, but the state is non-zero, the string ended prematurely; that is, the last byte indicated more bytes should have followed.

state the state of the decoding codep codepoint (valid only if resulting state is UTF8_ACCEPT) byte

next byte to decode

Return 
       new state

Note

The function has been edited: a std::array is used.

@copyright Copyright (c) 2008-2009 Bjoern Hoehrmann bjoern@hoehrmann.de

See http://bjoern.hoehrmann.de/utf-8/decoder/dfa/

docs.title: JSON_CATCH
docs.text:
JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)

@name value access Direct access to the stored value of a JSON value. @{ @brief get a pointer value (implicit)

See https://json.nlohmann.me/api/basic_json/get_ptr/ @brief get a pointer value (implicit) See https://json.nlohmann.me/api/basic_json/get_ptr/ @brief get a value (explicit)

Explicit type conversion between the JSON value and a compatible value which is CopyConstructible and DefaultConstructible. The value is converted by calling the from_json() method.

The function is equivalent to executing

   ValueType ret;
   JSONSerializer<ValueType>::from_json(*this, ret);
   return ret;

This overloads is chosen if: - ValueType is not - has a from_json() method of the form void from_json(const basic_json&, ValueType&), and - does not have a from_json() method of the form ValueType from_json(const basic_json&)

ValueType the returned value type Return copy of the JSON value, converted to ValueType Throw what from_json() method throws

@liveexample{The example below shows several conversions from JSON values to other types. There a few things to note: (1) Floating-point numbers can be converted to integers\, (2) A JSON array can be converted to a standard std::vector<short>\, (3) A JSON object can be converted to C++ associative containers such as std::unordered_map<std::string\, json>.,get__ValueType_const}

@since version 2.1.0 @brief get a value (explicit); special case

Explicit type conversion between the JSON value and a compatible value which is not CopyConstructible and not DefaultConstructible. The value is converted by calling the from_json() method.

The function is equivalent to executing

   return JSONSerializer<ValueType>::from_json(*this);

This overloads is chosen if: - ValueType is not and - has a from_json() method of the form ValueType from_json(const basic_json&)

Note

If has both overloads of from_json(), this one is chosen.

ValueType the returned value type Return copy of the JSON value, converted to ValueType Throw what from_json() method throws

@since version 2.1.0 @brief get special-case overload

This overloads converts the current in a different type

BasicJsonType == a copy of this, converted into BasicJsonType*

@complexity Depending on the implementation of the called from_json() method.

@since version 3.2.0 @brief get special-case overload

This overloads avoids a lot of template boilerplate, it can be seen as the identity method

BasicJsonType == a copy of *this

@complexity Constant.

@since version 2.1.0 @brief get a pointer value (explicit) @copydoc get() @brief get a (pointer) value (explicit)

Performs explicit type conversion between the JSON value and a compatible value if required.

  • If the requested type is a pointer to the internally stored JSON value that pointer is returned. No copies are made.

  • If the requested type is the current or a different convertible from the current - Otherwise the value is converted by calling the from_json() method.

ValueTypeCV the provided value type ValueType the returned value type Return copy of the JSON value, converted to ValueType if necessary Throw what from_json() method throws if conversion is required

@since version 2.1.0 @brief get a pointer value (explicit)

Explicit pointer access to the internally stored JSON value. No copies are made.

Warning

The pointer becomes invalid if the underlying JSON object changes.

PointerType pointer type; must be a pointer to object_t, boolean_t, number_unsigned_t, or pointer to the internally stored JSON value if the requested pointer type PointerType fits to the JSON value; nullptr otherwise

@complexity Constant.

@liveexample{The example below shows how pointers to internal values of a JSON value can be requested. Note that no type conversions are made and a nullptr is returned if the value and the requested pointer type does not match.,get__PointerType}

See see for explicit pointer-member access

@since version 1.0.0 @brief get a value (explicit)

See https://json.nlohmann.me/api/basic_json/get_to/ @brief get a reference value (implicit) See https://json.nlohmann.me/api/basic_json/get_ref/ @brief get a reference value (implicit) See https://json.nlohmann.me/api/basic_json/get_ref/ @brief get a value (implicit)

Implicit type conversion between the JSON value and a compatible value. The call is realized by calling const.

ValueType non-pointer type compatible to the JSON value, for instance int for JSON integer numbers, bool for JSON booleans, or std::vector types for JSON arrays. The character type of as well as an initializer list of this type is excluded to avoid ambiguities as these types implicitly convert to std::string. Return copy of the JSON value, converted to type ValueType Throw type_error.302 in case passed type ValueType is incompatible to the JSON value type (e.g., the JSON value is of type boolean, but a string is requested); see example below

@complexity Linear in the size of the JSON value.

@liveexample{The example below shows several conversions from JSON values to other types. There a few things to note: (1) Floating-point numbers can be converted to integers\, (2) A JSON array can be converted to a standard std::vector<short>\, (3) A JSON object can be converted to C++ associative containers such as std::unordered_map<std::string\, json>.,operator__ValueType}

@since version 1.0.0 @brief get a binary value

len The length (including the zero-byte at the end) of the string to be read. result A reference to the string variable where the read string is to be stored. NumberType The type of the length len Pre-condition len >= 1 Return true if the string was successfully parsed

@brief Read a BSON document element of the given element_type.

element_type The BSON element type, c.f. http://bsonspec.org/spec.html element_type_parse_position The position in the input stream, where the element_type was read.

Warning

Not all BSON element types are supported yet. An unsupported element_type will give rise to a parse_error.114: Unsupported BSON record type 0x...

Return whether a valid BSON-object/array was passed to the SAX parser

docs.title: parse_bson_element_list
docs.text:
bool parse_bson_element_list(const bool is_array)

@brief Read a BSON element list (as specified in the BSON-spec)

The same binary layout is used for objects and arrays, hence it must be indicated with the argument is_array which one is expected (true --> array, false --> object).

is_array Determines if the element list being read is to be treated as an object (@a is_array == false), or as an array (@a is_array == true). Return whether a valid BSON-object/array was passed to the SAX parser

class input_stream_adapter

the file pointer to read from

Input adapter for a (caching) istream. Ignores a UFT Byte Order Mark at beginning of input. Does not support changing the underlying std::streambuf in mid-input. Maintains underlying std::istream and std::streambuf to support subsequent use of standard std::istream operations to process any input characters following those used in parsing the JSON input. Clears the std::istream flags; any input errors (e.g., EOF) will be detected by the first subsequent call for input from the std::istream.

template<typename BasicJsonType> class iter_impl // NOLINT(cppcoreguidelines-special-member-functions,hicpp-special-member-functions)

@brief a template for a bidirectional iterator for the class This class implements a both iterators (iterator and const_iterator) for the class.

Note

An iterator is called initialized when a pointer to a JSON value has been set (e.g., by a constructor or a copy assignment). If the iterator is default-constructed, it is uninitialized and most methods are undefined. The library uses assertions to detect calls on uninitialized iterators.* @requirement The class satisfies the following concept requirements: - BidirectionalIterator: The iterator that can be moved can be moved in both directions (i.e. incremented and decremented). @since version 1.0.0, simplified in version 2.0.9, change to bidirectional iterators in version 3.0.0 (see https://github.com/nlohmann/json/issues/593)

docs.title: Types
docs.text: Name Description other_iter_impl the iterator with BasicJsonType of different const-ness object_t allow basic_json to access private members iterator_category The std::iterator class template (used as a base class to provide typedefs) is deprecated in C++17. The C++ Standard has never required user-defined iterators to derive from std::iterator. A user-defined iterator should provide publicly accessible typedefs named iterator_category, value_type, difference_type, pointer, and reference. Note that value_type is required to be non-const, even for constant iterators. value_type the type of the values when the iterator is dereferenced difference_type a type to represent differences between iterators pointer defines a pointer to the type iterated over (value_type) reference defines a reference to the type iterated over (value_type)

docs.title: set_end
docs.text:
class iter_impl // NOLINT(cppcoreguidelines-special-member-functions,hicpp-special-member-functions) { /// the iterator with BasicJsonType of different const-ness using other_iter_impl = iter_impl<typename std::conditional<std::is_const<BasicJsonType>::value, typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type, const BasicJsonType>::type>; /// allow basic_json to access private members friend other_iter_impl; friend BasicJsonType; friend iteration_proxy<iter_impl>; friend iteration_proxy_value<iter_impl>; using object_t = typename BasicJsonType::object_t; using array_t = typename BasicJsonType::array_t; // make sure BasicJsonType is basic_json or const basic_json static_assert(is_basic_json<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type>::value, "iter_impl only accepts (const) basic_json"); // superficial check for the LegacyBidirectionalIterator named requirement static_assert(std::is_base_of<std::bidirectional_iterator_tag, std::bidirectional_iterator_tag>::value && std::is_base_of<std::bidirectional_iterator_tag, typename std::iterator_traits<typename array_t::iterator>::iterator_category>::value, "basic_json iterator assumes array and object type iterators satisfy the LegacyBidirectionalIterator named requirement."); public: /// The std::iterator class template (used as a base class to provide typedefs) is deprecated in C++17. /// The C++ Standard has never required user-defined iterators to derive from std::iterator. /// A user-defined iterator should provide publicly accessible typedefs named /// iterator_category, value_type, difference_type, pointer, and reference. /// Note that value_type is required to be non-const, even for constant iterators. using iterator_category = std::bidirectional_iterator_tag; /// the type of the values when the iterator is dereferenced using value_type = typename BasicJsonType::value_type; /// a type to represent differences between iterators using difference_type = typename BasicJsonType::difference_type; /// defines a pointer to the type iterated over (value_type) using pointer = typename std::conditional<std::is_const<BasicJsonType>::value, typename BasicJsonType::const_pointer, typename BasicJsonType::pointer>::type; /// defines a reference to the type iterated over (value_type) using reference = typename std::conditional<std::is_const<BasicJsonType>::value, typename BasicJsonType::const_reference, typename BasicJsonType::reference>::type; iter_impl() = default; ~iter_impl() = default; iter_impl(iter_impl&&) noexcept = default; iter_impl& operator=(iter_impl&&) noexcept = default; /*! @brief constructor for a given JSON instance @param[in] object pointer to a JSON object for this iterator @pre object != nullptr @post The iterator is initialized; i.e. m_object != nullptr. */ explicit iter_impl(pointer object) noexcept : m_object(object) { JSON_ASSERT(m_object != nullptr); switch (m_object->m_data.m_type) { case value_t::object: { m_it.object_iterator = typename object_t::iterator(); break; } case value_t::array: { m_it.array_iterator = typename array_t::iterator(); break; } case value_t::null: case value_t::string: case value_t::boolean: case value_t::number_integer: case value_t::number_unsigned: case value_t::number_float: case value_t::binary: case value_t::discarded: default: { m_it.primitive_iterator = primitive_iterator_t(); break; } } } /*! @note The conventional copy constructor and copy assignment are implicitly defined. Combined with the following converting constructor and assignment, they support: (1) copy from iterator to iterator, (2) copy from const iterator to const iterator, and (3) conversion from iterator to const iterator. However conversion from const iterator to iterator is not defined. */ /*! @brief const copy constructor @param[in] other const iterator to copy from @note This copy constructor had to be defined explicitly to circumvent a bug occurring on msvc v19.0 compiler (VS 2015) debug build. For more information refer to: https://github.com/nlohmann/json/issues/1608 */ iter_impl(const iter_impl<const BasicJsonType>& other) noexcept : m_object(other.m_object), m_it(other.m_it) {} /*! @brief converting assignment @param[in] other const iterator to copy from @return const/non-const iterator @note It is not checked whether @a other is initialized. */ iter_impl& operator=(const iter_impl<const BasicJsonType>& other) noexcept { if (&other != this) { m_object = other.m_object; m_it = other.m_it; } return *this; } /*! @brief converting constructor @param[in] other non-const iterator to copy from @note It is not checked whether @a other is initialized. */ iter_impl(const iter_impl<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type>& other) noexcept : m_object(other.m_object), m_it(other.m_it) {} /*! @brief converting assignment @param[in] other non-const iterator to copy from @return const/non-const iterator @note It is not checked whether @a other is initialized. */ iter_impl& operator=(const iter_impl<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type>& other) noexcept // NOLINT(cert-oop54-cpp) { m_object = other.m_object; m_it = other.m_it; return *this; } JSON_PRIVATE_UNLESS_TESTED: /*! @brief set the iterator to the first value @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. m_object != nullptr. */ void set_begin() noexcept { JSON_ASSERT(m_object != nullptr); switch (m_object->m_data.m_type) { case value_t::object: { m_it.object_iterator = m_object->m_data.m_value.object->begin(); break; } case value_t::array: { m_it.array_iterator = m_object->m_data.m_value.array->begin(); break; } case value_t::null: { // set to end so begin()==end() is true: null is empty m_it.primitive_iterator.set_end(); break; } case value_t::string: case value_t::boolean: case value_t::number_integer: case value_t::number_unsigned: case value_t::number_float: case value_t::binary: case value_t::discarded: default: { m_it.primitive_iterator.set_begin(); break; } } } /*! @brief set the iterator past the last value @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. m_object != nullptr. */ void set_end() noexcept

@brief set the iterator past the last value

Pre-condition The iterator is initialized; i.e. m_object != nullptr.

docs.text: Name Description get_decimal_point ////////////////// ////////////////// return the locale-dependent decimal point get_codepoint ////////////////// ////////////////// @brief get codepoint from 4 hex characters following \u For input "\u c1 c2 c3 c4" the codepoint is: (c1 * 0x1000) + (c2 * 0x0100) + (c3 * 0x0010) + c4 = (c1 << 12) + (c2 << 8) + (c3 << 4) + (c4 << 0) Furthermore, the possible characters '0'..'9', 'A'..'F', and 'a'..'f' must be converted to the integers 0x0..0x9, 0xA..0xF, 0xA..0xF, resp. The conversion is done by subtracting the offset (0x30, 0x37, and 0x57) between the ASCII value of the character and the desired integer value. Return : codepoint (0x0000..0xFFFF) or -1 in case of an error (e.g. EOF or non-hex character) next_byte_in_range @brief check if the next byte(s) are inside a given range Adds the current byte and, for each passed range, reads a new byte and checks if it is inside the range. scan_string @brief scan a string literal This function scans a string according to Sect. scan_comment @brief scan a comment Return : whether comment could be scanned successfully scan_number @brief scan a number literal This function scans a string according to Sect. for literal_text : the literal text to expect length : the length of the passed literal text return_type : the token type to return on success

docs.title: get_codepoint
docs.text:
int get_codepoint()

////////////////// ////////////////// @brief get codepoint from 4 hex characters following \u

For input "\u c1 c2 c3 c4" the codepoint is: (c1 * 0x1000) + (c2 * 0x0100) + (c3 * 0x0010) + c4 = (c1 << 12) + (c2 << 8) + (c3 << 4) + (c4 << 0)

Furthermore, the possible characters '0'..'9', 'A'..'F', and 'a'..'f' must be converted to the integers 0x0..0x9, 0xA..0xF, 0xA..0xF, resp. The conversion is done by subtracting the offset (0x30, 0x37, and 0x57) between the ASCII value of the character and the desired integer value.

Return codepoint (0x0000..0xFFFF) or -1 in case of an error (e.g. EOF or non-hex character)

docs.title: next_byte_in_range
docs.text:
bool next_byte_in_range(std::initializer_list<char_int_type> ranges)

@brief check if the next byte(s) are inside a given range

Adds the current byte and, for each passed range, reads a new byte and checks if it is inside the range. If a violation was detected, set up an error message and return false. Otherwise, return true.

ranges list of integers; interpreted as list of pairs of inclusive lower and upper bound, respectively Pre-condition The passed list ranges must have 2, 4, or 6 elements; that is, 1, 2, or 3 pairs. This precondition is enforced by an assertion. Return true if and only if no range violation was detected

token_type scan_string()

@brief scan a string literal

This function scans a string according to Sect. 7 of RFC 8259. While scanning, bytes are escaped and copied into buffer token_buffer. Then the function returns successfully, token_buffer is not null-terminated (as it may contain \0 bytes), and token_buffer.size() is the number of bytes in the string.

Return token_type::value_string if string could be successfully scanned, token_type::parse_error otherwise

Note

In case of errors, variable error_message contains a textual description.

bool scan_comment()

@brief scan a comment

docs.title: scan_number
docs.text:
token_type scan_number() // lgtm [cpp/use-of-goto]

@brief scan a number literal

This function scans a string according to Sect. 6 of RFC 8259.

The function is realized with a deterministic finite state machine derived from the grammar described in RFC 8259. Starting in state "init", the input is read and used to determined the next state. Only state "done" accepts the number. State "error" is a trap state to model errors. In the table below, "anything" means any character but the ones listed before.

state 0 1-9 e E + - . anything init zero any1 [error] [error] minus [error] [error] minus zero any1 [error] [error] [error] [error] [error] zero done done exponent done done decimal1 done any1 any1 any1 exponent done done decimal1 done decimal1 decimal2 decimal2 [error] [error] [error] [error] [error] decimal2 decimal2 decimal2 exponent done done done done exponent any2 any2 [error] sign sign [error] [error] sign any2 any2 [error] [error] [error] [error] [error] any2 any2 any2 done done done done done

The state machine is realized with one label per state (prefixed with "scan_number_") and goto statements between them. The state machine contains cycles, but any cycle can be left when EOF is read. Therefore, the function is guaranteed to terminate.

During scanning, the read bytes are stored in token_buffer. This string is then converted to a signed integer, an unsigned integer, or a floating-point number.

Return token_type::value_unsigned, token_type::value_integer, or token_type::value_float if number could be successfully scanned, token_type::parse_error otherwise

Note

The scanner is independent of the current locale. Internally, the locale's decimal point is used instead of . to work with the locale-dependent converters.

docs.title: dump
docs.text:
void dump(const BasicJsonType& val, const bool pretty_print, const bool ensure_ascii, const unsigned int indent_step, const unsigned int current_indent = 0)

@brief internal implementation of the serialization function

This function is called by the public member function dump and organizes the serialization internally. The indentation level is propagated as additional parameter. In case of arrays and objects, the function is called recursively.

  • strings and object keys are escaped using escape_string()
  • integer numbers are converted implicitly via operator<<
  • floating-point numbers are converted to a string using "%g" format
  • binary values are serialized as objects containing the subtype and the byte array
val 
       value to serialize
pretty_print

whether the output shall be pretty-printed

ensure_ascii If ensure_ascii is true, all non-ASCII characters in the output are escaped with \uXXXX sequences, and the result consists of ASCII characters only. indent_step

the indent level

current_indent

the current indent level (only used internally)

docs.title: value_t
docs.text:
enum class value_t : std::uint8_t

//////////////////////// //////////////////////// @brief the JSON type enumeration

This enumeration collects the different JSON types. It is internally used to distinguish the stored values, and the functions basic_json::is_object(), basic_json::is_string(), basic_json::is_number() (with basic_json::is_number_unsigned(), and basic_json::is_discarded(),,) and rely on it.

Note

There are three enumeration entries (number_integer, number_unsigned, and number_float), because the library distinguishes these three types for numbers: is used for unsigned integers, is used for signed integers, and is used for floating-point numbers or to approximate integers which do not fit in the limits of their respective type.

See see value_t -- create a JSON value with the default value for a given type

@since version 1.0.0

null null value object object (unordered set of name/value pairs) array array (ordered collection of values) string string value boolean boolean value number_integer number value (signed integer) number_unsigned number value (unsigned integer) number_float number value (floating-point) binary binary array (ordered collection of bytes) discarded discarded by the parser callback function

class AssetStorage

This singleton stores all of the avaliable ressources in the asset directory. This includes sprites, audio, json prefabs and scripts All of the ressource's key names correspond to the name of their files in the asset directory.

The asset directory's structure cannot be modified

docs.title: ECSManager

class ECSManager

This class manages the entire engine. This is the class that is passed to scripts to be able to modify the game at will. It is also the one managing and executing the registry (component and entity manager) as well as the systems It is also responsible for json parsing as well as world management.

docs.title: Functions
docs.text: Name Description ECSManager Create the engine's class that manages all the worlds and systems. createWorld Create an empty world with a name path : Name of the world to create changeWorld Changes the currently active world worldName : name of the world loadWorld Load a world from a configuration file path : Path of the world's configuration file runSystems Runs all of the systems at once run Launches the game engine's loop getCurrentRegistry Returns the current world's registry Return : Current registry of the world createEntity Create an empty entity in the current world Return : ID of the created entity createEntityFromPrefab Create an entity from a prefab in the AssetStorage singleton prefabName : name of the prefab Return : ID of the created entity destroyEntity Destroy an entity in the current world id : Entity ID to destroy getWindow Returns the used window's pointer wrapped in a shared::ptr Return : SFML window getDeltaTime Returns elaped time this frame in seconds Return : Elapsed time addSystem Create a world from a world configuration System : Struct of the system Args : Arguments required by the system at initialisation (usually the window) addComponent Add a component to an entity in the current world id : Entity ID Component : Component's struct which's values are setup or not removeComponent Remove a component from an entity in the current world id : Entity ID Component : Component's struct !!! warning It should be called like this: removeComponent(id) getComponent Get a component from an entity in the current world, you can then modify the shared_ptr component to directly modify it's information inside the entity, no need to re-add it id : Entity ID Component : Component's struct !!! warning It should be called like this: getComponent(id) Return : Entity's component wrapped in a shared_ptr getEntitiesWithComponent Returns a list of all the entities that have a component type, usefull when you create a System or want to know only certain entities to increase performance Component : Component's struct !!! warning It should be called like this: getEntitiesWithComponent()

/*
** EPITECH PROJECT, 2024
** Rtype
** File description:
** main
*/

#include <SFML/Graphics.hpp>
#include "Game/Game.hpp"
#include "Scene/SceneManager/SceneManager.hpp"
#include "RessourcesManager/ressourcesManager.hpp"
#include <iostream>

int main() {
    try {
        RType::GUI::ResourceManager::loadAllResources();
        RType::GUI::SceneManager sceneManager;
        RType::GUI::Game game(sceneManager);
        game.run();
        RType::GUI::ResourceManager::clearResources();
    } catch (const std::exception& e) {
        std::cerr << "Erreur: " << e.what() << std::endl;
        return 1;
    }

    return 0;
}

docs.text:
/*
** EPITECH PROJECT, 2024
** Rtype
** File description:
** Game
*/

#include "Game.hpp"

namespace RType {
    namespace GUI {

        Game::Game(SceneManager& sceneManager)
            : _window(std::make_shared<sf::RenderWindow>(sf::VideoMode(1000, 800), "Main Window")), _sceneManager(sceneManager), _fpsLimit(60), _volumeSound(100.00f) {
                initScene();
        }

        void Game::run() {
            sf::Clock clock;
            while (_window->isOpen()) {
                sf::Time dt = clock.restart();
                processEvents();
                _sceneManager.update(dt);
                render();
            }
        }

        void Game::setFPSLimit(int fps) {
            _fpsLimit = fps;
            _window->setFramerateLimit(_fpsLimit);
        }

        void Game::initScene() {
            try {
                _sceneManager.addScene("menu", std::make_shared<MainMenu>(_sceneManager, _window));
                _sceneManager.addScene("setting", std::make_shared<Setting>(_sceneManager, _window));
                _sceneManager.addScene("hostGame", std::make_shared<HostGame>(_sceneManager, _window));
                _sceneManager.addScene("joinGame", std::make_shared<JoinGame>(_sceneManager, _window));
                _sceneManager.addScene("credit", std::make_shared<Credit>(_sceneManager, _window));
                _sceneManager.changeScene("menu");
                setFPSLimit(_fpsLimit);
                _menuMusic = ResourceManager::getMusic("MenuMusic.wav");
                _menuMusic->setLoop(true);
                _menuMusic->play();
            } catch (const std::exception& e) {
                std::cerr << "Error during scene initialization: " << e.what() << std::endl;
                throw;
            }
        }

        void Game::processEvents() {
            sf::Event event;
            while (_window->pollEvent(event)) {
                if (event.type == sf::Event::Closed) {
                    _window->close();
                }
                _sceneManager.handleEvent(event);
            }
        }

        void Game::render() {
            _window->clear();
            _sceneManager.render(*_window);
            _window->display();
        }

    }
}

/*

#ifndef GAME_HPP
    #define GAME_HPP

#include <SFML/Graphics.hpp>
#include "Scene/SceneManager/SceneManager.hpp"
#include "RessourcesManager/ressourcesManager.hpp"
#include "Scene/Menu_scene/menu_s.hpp"
#include "Scene/Setting_scene/setting_s.hpp"
#include "Scene/HostGame_scene/hostGame_s.hpp"
#include "Scene/JoinGame_scene/joinGame_s.hpp"
#include "Scene/Credit_scene/credit_s.hpp"

namespace RType {
    namespace GUI {
        class Game {
        public:
            Game(SceneManager& sceneManager);

            void run();
            void initScene();
            void setFPSLimit(int fps);
            void setVolumeSound(float newVolume) {_volumeSound = newVolume; };

            float getVolumeSound() { return _volumeSound; };

        private:
            void processEvents();
            void update(sf::Time dt);

#include "AObjet.hpp"

namespace RType {
    namespace GUI {
        namespace Objet {
            AObjet::AObjet() {
            }

            AObjet::~AObjet() {
            }

            void AObjet::destroy() {
                _isDestroyed = true;
            }

            void AObjet::draw(sf::RenderWindow& window) const {
                if (!_isDestroyed) {
                    window.draw(_shape);
                }
            }

            void AObjet::resize(float factor) {
                _shape.setSize(_shape.getSize() * factor);
            }

            void AObjet::update(const sf::RenderWindow& window) {
            }

            void AObjet::setPosition(sf::Vector2f position) {
                _shape.setPosition(position);
            }

            void AObjet::setSize(sf::Vector2f size) {
                _shape.setSize(size);
            }

            void AObjet::setColor(sf::Color color) {
                _color = color;
                _shape.setFillColor(_color);
            }

            void AObjet::setLabel(const std::string& label) {
                _label = label;
            }

            bool RType::GUI::Objet::AObjet::isClicked(const sf::Vector2i& mousePosition) const {
                if (_isDestroyed)
                    return false;
                sf::FloatRect bounds = _shape.getGlobalBounds();
                return bounds.contains(static_cast<float>(mousePosition.x), static_cast<float>(mousePosition.y));
            }
        }
    }
}

#include "background.hpp"

namespace RType {
    namespace GUI {
        namespace Objet {

            Background::Background(std::string texture) {
                m_texture = &ResourceManager::getTexture(texture);
                m_sprite.setTexture(*m_texture);
                m_sprite.setPosition(0, 0);
            }

            void Background::resize(const sf::Vector2u& windowSize) {
                if (!m_texture) return;
                sf::Vector2u textureSize = m_texture->getSize();
                float scaleX = static_cast<float>(windowSize.x) / textureSize.x;
                float scaleY = static_cast<float>(windowSize.y) / textureSize.y;
                m_sprite.setScale(scaleX, scaleY);
            }

            void Background::draw(sf::RenderWindow& window) const {
                window.draw(m_sprite);
            }

        }
    }
}

/*

** Rtype

** customButton Component
*/

#include "costumButton.hpp"

namespace RType {
    namespace GUI {
        namespace Objet {

            CustomButton::CustomButton(sf::Vector2f position, sf::Vector2f size, const std::string& text, unsigned int charSize, sf::Color color, const std::string& spriteTexture, const std::string& font)
                : _position(position), _size(size), _color(color), _state(DEFAULT) {
                    _buttonTexture = ResourceManager::getTexture(spriteTexture);
                    _buttonSprite.setTexture(_buttonTexture);
                    _buttonSprite.setColor(_color);
                    _buttonSprite.setPosition(position);
                    _buttonSprite.setScale(size.x / _buttonTexture.getSize().x, size.y / _buttonTexture.getSize().y);
                    _text = std::make_unique<Text>(std::make_pair(position.x, position.y), text, charSize, sf::Color::White, font);
                    sf::Vector2f textSize = _text->getSize();
                    float textX = position.x + (size.x - textSize.x) / 2;
                    float textY = position.y + (size.y - textSize.y) / 3.5;
                    _text->setPosition(sf::Vector2f(textX, textY));
            }

            void CustomButton::draw(sf::RenderWindow& window) const {
                window.draw(_buttonSprite);
                if (_text) {
                    _text->draw(window);
                }
            }

            void CustomButton::update(const sf::RenderWindow& window) {
                sf::Vector2i mousePosition = sf::Mouse::getPosition(window);
                bool isMouseOver = _buttonSprite.getGlobalBounds().contains(static_cast<sf::Vector2f>(mousePosition));

                if (isMouseOver) {
                    if (_state != HOVER) {
                        _state = HOVER;
                        _buttonSprite.setColor(sf::Color(150, 150, 150));
                    }
                    if (sf::Mouse::isButtonPressed(sf::Mouse::Left)) {
                        if (_state != CLICKED) {
                            _state = CLICKED;
                            _buttonSprite.setColor(sf::Color(100, 100, 100));
                            ResourceManager::playSound("buttonClick.wav");
                        }
                    }
                } else {
                    if (_state != DEFAULT) {
                        _state = DEFAULT;
                        _buttonSprite.setColor(_color);
                    }
                }
            }

            bool CustomButton::isClicked(const sf::Vector2i& mousePosition) const {
                return _buttonSprite.getGlobalBounds().contains(static_cast<sf::Vector2f>(mousePosition));
            }

            void CustomButton::setPosition(sf::Vector2f position) {
                _position = position;
                _buttonSprite.setPosition(position);
            }

            void CustomButton::setSize(sf::Vector2f size) {
                _size = size;
                _buttonSprite.setScale(size.x / _buttonTexture.getSize().x, size.y / _buttonTexture.getSize().y);
            }

        }
    }
}

** GeneriqueButton Component
*/

#include "generiqueButton.hpp"

namespace RType {
    namespace GUI {
        namespace Objet {

            GeneriqueButton::GeneriqueButton() = default;

            void GeneriqueButton::addButton(std::shared_ptr<AObjet> button) {
                _buttons.push_back(button);
            }

            void GeneriqueButton::draw(sf::RenderWindow& window) const {
                for (const auto& button : _buttons) {
                    button->draw(window);
                }
            }

            void GeneriqueButton::update(const sf::RenderWindow& window) {
                for (const auto& button : _buttons) {
                    button->update(window);
                }
            }

            bool GeneriqueButton::isClicked(const sf::Vector2i& mousePosition) const {
                for (const auto& button : _buttons) {
                    if (button->isClicked(mousePosition)) {
                        return true;
                    }
                }
                return false;
            }

            void GeneriqueButton::setPosition(sf::Vector2f position) {
                sf::Vector2f offset(0, 0);
                for (const auto& button : _buttons) {
                    button->setPosition(position + offset);
                    offset.y += button->getSize().y + 10;
                }
            }

        }
    }
}

#include "joinRoomButton.hpp"

namespace RType {
    namespace GUI {
        namespace Objet {
            JoinRoomButton::JoinRoomButton(const sf::Vector2f& position, const sf::Vector2f& size, const std::string& leftText, const std::string& rightText, const std::string& font, unsigned int charSize)
                : _state(DEFAULT), _hoverFillColor(sf::Color(128, 128, 128)), _position(position), _size(size) {
                    _border.setPosition(position);
                    _border.setSize(size);
                    _border.setFillColor(sf::Color::Transparent);
                    _border.setOutlineThickness(2.0f);
                    _border.setOutlineColor(sf::Color::White);

                    _font = ResourceManager::getFont(font);
                    _leftText.setFont(_font);
                    _leftText.setString(leftText);
                    _leftText.setCharacterSize(charSize);
                    _leftText.setFillColor(sf::Color::White);
                    _leftText.setPosition(position.x + 10, position.y + (size.y - charSize) / 2);

                    _rightText.setFont(_font);
                    _rightText.setString(rightText);
                    _rightText.setCharacterSize(charSize);
                    _rightText.setFillColor(sf::Color::White);
                    _rightText.setPosition(position.x + size.x - _rightText.getGlobalBounds().width - 10, 
                                           position.y + (size.y - charSize) / 2);
            }

            void JoinRoomButton::draw(sf::RenderWindow& window) const {
                window.draw(_border);
                window.draw(_leftText);
                window.draw(_rightText);
            }

            void JoinRoomButton::update(const sf::RenderWindow& window) {
                sf::Vector2i mousePos = sf::Mouse::getPosition(window);
                bool containsMouse = _border.getGlobalBounds().contains(static_cast<sf::Vector2f>(mousePos));

                if (containsMouse) {
                    if (_state != HOVER) {
                        _state = HOVER;
                        _border.setFillColor(_hoverFillColor);
                    }

                    if (sf::Mouse::isButtonPressed(sf::Mouse::Left)) {
                        if (_state != CLICKED) {
                            _state = CLICKED;
                            ResourceManager::playSound("buttonClick.wav");
                        }
                    } else {
                        if (_state != HOVER) {
                            _state = HOVER;
                        }
                    }
                } else {
                    if (_state != DEFAULT) {
                        _state = DEFAULT;
                        _border.setFillColor(sf::Color::Transparent);
                    }
                }
            }

            bool JoinRoomButton::isClicked(const sf::Vector2i& mousePosition) const {
                return _border.getGlobalBounds().contains(static_cast<sf::Vector2f>(mousePosition));
            }
        }
    }
}

/*
** EPITECH PROJECT, 2024
** Rtype
** File description:
** SliderVolume Component
*/

#include "sliderVolume.hpp"

namespace RType {
    namespace GUI {
        namespace Objet {

            SliderVolume::SliderVolume(float x, float y, float width, float height, const std::string label)
                : _volume(50.0f), _isDragging(false), _label(label) {
                    _font = ResourceManager::getFont("Arial.ttf");
                    _background.setSize(sf::Vector2f(width, height));
                    _background.setPosition(x, y);
                    _background.setFillColor(sf::Color(200, 200, 200));
                    _background.setOutlineThickness(2);
                    _background.setOutlineColor(sf::Color(150, 150, 150));
                    _slider.setSize(sf::Vector2f(10, height));
                    _slider.setPosition(x + (width * (_volume / 100.0f)), y);
                    _slider.setFillColor(sf::Color::Red);
                    _volumeText.setFont(_font);
                    _volumeText.setCharacterSize(20);
                    _volumeText.setFillColor(sf::Color::White);
                    updateText();
                    _volumeText.setPosition(x + width + 10, y);
            }

            SliderVolume::~SliderVolume() {}

            void SliderVolume::update(const sf::RenderWindow& window) {
                sf::Vector2i mousePos = sf::Mouse::getPosition(window);
                if (_isDragging)
                    updateVolume(window);
                if (sf::Mouse::isButtonPressed(sf::Mouse::Left)) {
                    sf::FloatRect bounds = _slider.getGlobalBounds();
                    if (bounds.contains(static_cast<sf::Vector2f>(mousePos))) {
                        _isDragging = true;
                    }
                } else {
                    _isDragging = false;
                }
                updateText();
            }

            void SliderVolume::draw(sf::RenderWindow& window) const {
                window.draw(_background);
                window.draw(_slider);
                window.draw(_volumeText);
            }

            void SliderVolume::setVolume(float volume) {
                _volume = volume;
                updateText();
            }

            void SliderVolume::updateVolume(const sf::RenderWindow& window) {
                sf::Vector2i mousePos = sf::Mouse::getPosition(window);
                sf::FloatRect bounds = _background.getGlobalBounds();

                if (bounds.contains(static_cast<sf::Vector2f>(mousePos))) {
                    float newVolume = (mousePos.x - bounds.left) / bounds.width * 100.0f;
                    newVolume = std::max(0.0f, std::min(100.0f, newVolume));
                    _volume = newVolume;
                    _slider.setPosition(bounds.left + (bounds.width * (_volume / 100.0f)), bounds.top);
                }
            }

            void SliderVolume::updateText() {
                _volumeText.setString(std::to_string(static_cast<int>(_volume)) + "%");
            }

        }
    }
}

            SpriteButton::SpriteButton(sf::Vector2f position, sf::Vector2f size, const std::string& textureFile, const std::string label)
                : _size(size), _position(position), _label(label) {
                    _texture = ResourceManager::getTexture(textureFile);
                    _sprite.setTexture(_texture);
                    _sprite.setPosition(position);
                    _sprite.setScale(size.x / _texture.getSize().x, size.y / _texture.getSize().y);
                    _originalColor = _sprite.getColor();
                    _hoverColor = sf::Color(200, 200, 200);
                    _clickedColor = sf::Color(150, 150, 150);
            }

            void SpriteButton::draw(sf::RenderWindow& window) const {
                window.draw(_sprite);
            }

            void SpriteButton::update(const sf::RenderWindow& window) {
                sf::Vector2i mousePos = sf::Mouse::getPosition(window);
                bool isHovered = _sprite.getGlobalBounds().contains(static_cast<sf::Vector2f>(mousePos));

                if (isHovered) {
                    if (sf::Mouse::isButtonPressed(sf::Mouse::Left)) {
                        _sprite.setColor(_clickedColor);
                        ResourceManager::playSound("buttonClick.wav");
                    } else {
                        _sprite.setColor(_hoverColor);
                    }
                } else {
                    _sprite.setColor(_originalColor);
                }
            }

            void SpriteButton::setPosition(sf::Vector2f position) {
                _sprite.setPosition(position);
            }

            void SpriteButton::setSize(sf::Vector2f size) {
                _sprite.setScale(size.x / _texture.getSize().x, size.y / _texture.getSize().y);
            }

            bool SpriteButton::isClicked(const sf::Vector2i& mousePosition) const {
                return _sprite.getGlobalBounds().contains(static_cast<sf::Vector2f>(mousePosition));
            }

        }
    }
}

/*

** ButtonText Component

#include "textButton.hpp"

namespace RType {
    namespace GUI {
        namespace Objet {

            TextButton::TextButton(sf::Vector2f position, const std::string& text, unsigned int charSize, sf::Color defaultColor, sf::Color hoverColor, sf::Color clickedColor, const std::string& font)
                : _position(position), _defaultColor(defaultColor), _hoverColor(hoverColor), _clickedColor(clickedColor), _state(DEFAULT) {
                    _text = std::make_unique<Text>(std::make_pair(position.x, position.y), text, charSize, defaultColor, font);
            }

            void TextButton::draw(sf::RenderWindow& window) const {
                if (_text) {
                    _text->draw(window);
                }
            }

            void TextButton::update(const sf::RenderWindow& window) {
                sf::Vector2i mousePosition = sf::Mouse::getPosition(window);
                sf::Vector2f mousePosF(static_cast<float>(mousePosition.x), static_cast<float>(mousePosition.y));
                sf::FloatRect buttonBounds = _text->getBounds();
                bool isMouseOver = buttonBounds.contains(mousePosF);

                if (isMouseOver) {
                    if (_state != CLICKED && sf::Mouse::isButtonPressed(sf::Mouse::Left)) {
                        _state = CLICKED;
                        _text->setColor(_clickedColor);
                        ResourceManager::playSound("buttonClick.wav");
                    } else if (_state != CLICKED) {
                        _state = HOVER;
                        _text->setColor(_hoverColor);
                    }
                } else if (_state != DEFAULT) {
                    _state = DEFAULT;
                    _text->setColor(_defaultColor);
                }
                if (!sf::Mouse::isButtonPressed(sf::Mouse::Left) && _state == CLICKED) {
                    _state = DEFAULT;
                    _text->setColor(_defaultColor);
                }
            }

            bool TextButton::isClicked(const sf::Vector2i& mousePosition) const {
                sf::FloatRect buttonBounds = _text->getBounds();
                return buttonBounds.contains(static_cast<sf::Vector2f>(mousePosition));
            }

            void TextButton::setPosition(sf::Vector2f position) {
                _position = position;
                _text->setPosition(position);
            }

            void TextButton::setColor(sf::Color color) {
                _defaultColor = color;
                _text->setColor(color);
            }

        }
    }
}

#include "text.hpp"

namespace RType {

            Text::Text(std::pair<float, float> position, const std::string& text, unsigned int charSize, const sf::Color& color, const std::string& fontType) {
                _font = ResourceManager::getFont(fontType);
                _text.setFont(_font);

                _text.setCharacterSize(charSize);
                _text.setFillColor(color);
                _text.setPosition(position.first, position.second);
                _fontSize = charSize;

                window.draw(_text);
            }

            void Text::resize(float factor) {
                _text.setCharacterSize(_fontSize);

                _text.setPosition(position);

                _text.setFillColor(color);
            }

            void Text::setLabel(const std::string& label) {
                _text.setString(sf::String::fromUtf8(label.begin(), label.end()));
            }
        }
    }
}

/*
** EPITECH PROJECT, 2024
** Rtype
** File description:
** Ressource Manager
*/

#include "ressourcesManager.hpp"

namespace RType {
    namespace GUI {

        std::unordered_map<std::string, sf::Texture> ResourceManager::_textures;
        std::unordered_map<std::string, sf::Font> ResourceManager::_fonts;
        std::unordered_map<std::string, std::unique_ptr<sf::Music>> ResourceManager::_musics;
        std::unordered_map<std::string, sf::SoundBuffer> ResourceManager::_sounds;
        std::unordered_map<std::string, sf::Sound> ResourceManager::_activeSounds;
        bool ResourceManager::_soundEnabled = true;
        bool ResourceManager::_musicEnabled = true;

        void ResourceManager::loadAllResources() {
            loadTexture("backgroundMenu.jpg", "assets/background/backgroundMenu.jpg");
            loadTexture("backgroundSetting.jpg", "assets/background/backgroundSetting.jpg");
            loadTexture("logo.png", "assets/logo/Epitech_logo.png");
            loadTexture("Arnaud.png", "assets/credit/Arnaud.png");
            loadTexture("Clement.png", "assets/credit/Clement.jpg");
            loadTexture("Alexandre.png", "assets/credit/Alexandre.png");
            loadTexture("Jule.png", "assets/credit/Jule.png");
            loadTexture("Lucas.png", "assets/credit/Lucas.jpg");
            loadTexture("button.png", "assets/button/button.png");
            loadTexture("button2.png", "assets/button/button2.png");
            loadTexture("backButton.png", "assets/button/backButton.png");
            loadFont("Arial.ttf", "assets/fonts/arial.ttf");
            loadMusic("MenuMusic.wav", "assets/music/MenuMusic.wav");
            loadSound("buttonClick.wav", "assets/sounds/buttonClick.wav");
        }

        void ResourceManager::clearResources() {
            _textures.clear();
            _fonts.clear();
            _musics.clear();
            _sounds.clear();
            _activeSounds.clear();
        }

        //////////////////////////////////// TEXTURES ////////////////////////////////////

        bool ResourceManager::loadTexture(const std::string& textureLabel, const std::string& filename) {
            if (isTextureLoaded(textureLabel))
                return true;
            sf::Texture texture;
            if (!texture.loadFromFile(filename)) {
                std::cerr << "Failed to load texture: " << filename << std::endl;
                return false;
            }
            _textures[textureLabel] = std::move(texture);
            return true;
        }

        sf::Texture& ResourceManager::getTexture(const std::string& textureLabel) {
            auto thisTexture = _textures.find(textureLabel);
            if (thisTexture == _textures.end()) {
                throw std::runtime_error("Texture not found: " + textureLabel);
            }
            return thisTexture->second;
        }

        bool ResourceManager::isTextureLoaded(const std::string& textureLabel) {
            return _textures.find(textureLabel) != _textures.end();
        }

        //////////////////////////////////// FONTS ///////////////////////////////////////

        bool ResourceManager::loadFont(const std::string& fontLabel, const std::string& filename) {
            if (isFontLoaded(fontLabel))
                return true;
            sf::Font font;
            if (!font.loadFromFile(filename)) {
                std::cerr << "Failed to load font: " << filename << std::endl;
                return false;
            }
            _fonts[fontLabel] = std::move(font);
            return true;
        }

        sf::Font& ResourceManager::getFont(const std::string& fontLabel) {
            auto thisFont = _fonts.find(fontLabel);
            if (thisFont == _fonts.end()) {
                throw std::runtime_error("Font not found: " + fontLabel);
            }
            return thisFont->second;
        }

        bool ResourceManager::isFontLoaded(const std::string& fontLabel) {
            return _fonts.find(fontLabel) != _fonts.end();
        }

        //////////////////////////////////// MUSIC ///////////////////////////////////////

        bool ResourceManager::loadMusic(const std::string& musicLabel, const std::string& filename) {
            if (isMusicLoaded(musicLabel))
                return true;
            auto music = std::make_unique<sf::Music>();
            if (!music->openFromFile(filename)) {
                std::cerr << "Failed to load music: " << filename << std::endl;
                return false;
            }
            music->setVolume(100);
            _musics[musicLabel] = std::move(music);
            return true;
        }

        sf::Music* ResourceManager::getMusic(const std::string& musicLabel) {
            auto thisMusic = _musics.find(musicLabel);
            if (thisMusic == _musics.end()) {
                throw std::runtime_error("Music not found: " + musicLabel);
            }
            return thisMusic->second.get();
        }

        bool ResourceManager::isMusicLoaded(const std::string& musicLabel) {
            return _musics.find(musicLabel) != _musics.end();
        }

        void ResourceManager::updateMusicVolume(const std::string& musicLabel, float volume) {
            sf::Music* music = getMusic(musicLabel);
            if (music) {
                music->setVolume(volume);
            }
        }

        //////////////////////////////////// SOUNDS ///////////////////////////////////////

        bool ResourceManager::loadSound(const std::string& soundLabel, const std::string& filename) {
            if (isSoundLoaded(soundLabel))
                return true;
            sf::SoundBuffer soundBuffer;
            if (!soundBuffer.loadFromFile(filename)) {
                std::cerr << "Failed to load sound: " << filename << std::endl;
                return false;
            }
            _sounds[soundLabel] = std::move(soundBuffer);
            return true;
        }

        sf::SoundBuffer& ResourceManager::getSound(const std::string& soundLabel) {
            auto thisSound = _sounds.find(soundLabel);
            if (thisSound == _sounds.end()) {
                throw std::runtime_error("Sound not found: " + soundLabel);
            }
            return thisSound->second;
        }

        bool ResourceManager::isSoundLoaded(const std::string& soundLabel) {
            return _sounds.find(soundLabel) != _sounds.end();
        }

        void ResourceManager::playSound(const std::string& soundLabel) {
            if (!_soundEnabled)
                return;
            if (!isSoundLoaded(soundLabel))
                loadSound(soundLabel, soundLabel);
            if (_activeSounds.find(soundLabel) != _activeSounds.end()) {
                _activeSounds[soundLabel].play();
            } else {
                sf::Sound sound;
                sound.setBuffer(getSound(soundLabel));
                sound.setVolume(100.f);
                sound.play();
                _activeSounds[soundLabel] = std::move(sound);
            }
        }

        void ResourceManager::updateAllSoundsVolume(float volume) {
            for (auto& [label, sound] : _activeSounds) {
                sound.setVolume(volume);
            }
        }

        void ResourceManager::clearInactiveSounds() {
            for (auto it = _activeSounds.begin(); it != _activeSounds.end();) {
                if (it->second.getStatus() != sf::Sound::Playing) {
                    it = _activeSounds.erase(it);
                } else {
                    ++it;
                }
            }
        }
    }
}

            // Handle sounds

            static void playSound(const std::string& soundLabel);
            static void updateAllSoundsVolume(float volume);
            static void clearInactiveSounds();
            static void toggleSounds(bool enabled){_soundEnabled = enabled;};

        private:
            static std::unordered_map<std::string, sf::Texture> _textures;
            static std::unordered_map<std::string, sf::Font> _fonts;
            static std::unordered_map<std::string, std::unique_ptr<sf::Music>> _musics;
            static std::unordered_map<std::string, sf::SoundBuffer> _sounds;
            static std::unordered_map<std::string, sf::Sound> _activeSounds;
            static bool _soundEnabled;
            static bool _musicEnabled;

}

/*

** credit Scene

#include "credit_s.hpp"

namespace RType {
    namespace GUI {

        Credit::Credit(SceneManager& sceneManager, std::shared_ptr<sf::RenderWindow>& window)
            : c_sceneManager(sceneManager), c_background(nullptr), c_window(window) {
            c_background = std::make_unique<Objet::Background>("backgroundMenu.jpg");
            c_texts.emplace_back(std::make_unique<Objet::Text>(std::make_pair(100.0f, 50.0f), "Crédits", 40, sf::Color::White, "Arial.ttf"));
            c_generiqueButton.addButton(std::make_shared<Objet::SpriteButton>(
                sf::Vector2f(0.0f, 0.0f),
                sf::Vector2f(100.0f, 30.0f),
                "backButton.png", "backButton"
            ));

            sf::Texture& logoTexture = ResourceManager::getTexture("Arnaud.png");
            c_logoSprite.setTexture(logoTexture);
            c_logoSprite.setPosition(400.f, 50.f);

        }

        void Credit::handleEvent(const sf::Event& event) {
            if (event.type == sf::Event::MouseButtonPressed && event.mouseButton.button == sf::Mouse::Left) {
                sf::Vector2i mousePosition(event.mouseButton.x, event.mouseButton.y);
                if (c_generiqueButton.isClicked(mousePosition)) {
                    for (const auto& button : c_generiqueButton.getButtons()) {
                        if (button->isClicked(mousePosition)) {
                            const std::string& label = button->getLabel();
                            if (label == "Settings") {
                                nextScene("setting");
                            }
                            if (label == "backButton") {
                                nextScene("menu");
                            }
                            break;
                        }
                    }
                }
            }
        }

        void Credit::resize(sf::RenderWindow& window, const sf::Vector2u& baseSize) {
        }

        void Credit::update(sf::Time dt) {
        }

        void Credit::render(sf::RenderWindow& window) {
            c_background->draw(window);
            window.draw(c_logoSprite);
            c_generiqueButton.update(*c_window);
            c_generiqueButton.draw(window);
            for (const auto& text : c_texts) {
                text->draw(window);
            }
        }

        void Credit::nextScene(const std::string& sceneName) {
            c_sceneManager.changeScene(sceneName);
        }
    }
}

        MainMenu::MainMenu(SceneManager& sceneManager, std::shared_ptr<sf::RenderWindow>& window)
            : m_sceneManager(sceneManager), m_background(nullptr), _window(window) {
            m_background = std::make_unique<Objet::Background>("backgroundMenu.jpg");
            sf::Texture& logoTexture = ResourceManager::getTexture("logo.png");
            m_logoSprite.setTexture(logoTexture);
            m_logoSprite.setPosition(400.f, 50.f);

            m_generiqueButton.addButton(std::make_shared<Objet::TextButton>(
                sf::Vector2f(200.0f, 150.0f),
