            m_generiqueButton.addButton(std::make_shared<Objet::TextButton>(
                sf::Vector2f(200.0f, 200.0f),
                "Host Game", 30, sf::Color::White, sf::Color::Yellow, sf::Color::Red, "Arial.ttf"
            ));

            m_generiqueButton.addButton(std::make_shared<Objet::TextButton>(
                sf::Vector2f(200.0f, 300.0f),
                "Settings", 30, sf::Color::White, sf::Color::Yellow, sf::Color::Red, "Arial.ttf"

                sf::Vector2f(200.0f, 350.0f),
                "Credits", 30, sf::Color::White, sf::Color::Yellow, sf::Color::Red, "Arial.ttf"
            ));

            m_generiqueButton.addButton(std::make_shared<Objet::TextButton>(
                sf::Vector2f(200.0f, 400.0f),
                "Quit", 30, sf::Color::Red, sf::Color::Yellow, sf::Color::Red, "Arial.ttf"
            ));
        }

        void MainMenu::handleEvent(const sf::Event& event) {
            if (event.type == sf::Event::MouseButtonReleased && event.mouseButton.button == sf::Mouse::Left) {
                sf::Vector2i mousePosition(event.mouseButton.x, event.mouseButton.y);
                for (const auto& button : m_generiqueButton.getButtons()) {
                    if (button->isClicked(mousePosition)) {
                        const std::string& label = button->getLabel();
                        if (label == "Settings") {
                            nextScene("setting");
                        } else if (label == "Host Game") {
                            nextScene("hostGame");
                        } else if (label == "Join Game") {
                            nextScene("joinGame");
                        } else if (label == "Credits") {
                            nextScene("credit");
                        }
                    }
                }
            }
        }

            window.draw(m_logoSprite);
            m_generiqueButton.update(*_window);
            m_generiqueButton.draw(window);
        }

        void MainMenu::nextScene(const std::string& sceneName) {
            m_sceneManager.changeScene(sceneName);
        }
    }

/*
** EPITECH PROJECT, 2024
** Rtype
** File description:
** SceneManager
*/

#include "SceneManager.hpp"
namespace RType {
    namespace GUI {

        SceneManager::SceneManager() : _currentScene(nullptr) {}

        void SceneManager::addScene(const std::string& name, std::shared_ptr<IScene> scene) {
            if (_scenes.find(name) != _scenes.end()) {
                throw std::runtime_error("Scene '" + name + "' already exists!");
            }
            _scenes[name] = scene;
        }

        void SceneManager::changeScene(const std::string& sceneName) {
            auto currentScene = _scenes.find(sceneName);
            if (currentScene == _scenes.end()) {
                std::cerr << "Scene '" << sceneName << "' not found!" << std::endl;
                return;
            }
            _currentScene = currentScene->second;
        }

        void SceneManager::handleEvent(const sf::Event& event) {
            if (_currentScene) {
                _currentScene->handleEvent(event);
            }
        }

        void SceneManager::update(sf::Time dt) {
            if (_currentScene) {
                _currentScene->update(dt);
            }
        }

        void SceneManager::render(sf::RenderWindow& window) {
            if (_currentScene) {
                _currentScene->render(window);
            }
        }

        void SceneManager::resizeScene(sf::RenderWindow& window, const sf::Vector2u& baseSize) {
            for (auto& pair : _scenes) {
                pair.second->resize(window, baseSize);
            }
        }
    }
}

        : s_sceneManager(sceneManager), _window(window) {

            s_texts.emplace_back(std::make_unique<Objet::Text>(std::make_pair(100.0f, 50.0f), "Settings", 40, sf::Color::White, "Arial.ttf"));
            s_generiqueButton.addButton(std::make_shared<Objet::SpriteButton>(
                sf::Vector2f(0.0f, 0.0f),
                sf::Vector2f(100.0f, 30.0f),
                "backButton.png", "backButton"
            ));
            s_generiqueButton.addButton(std::make_shared<Objet::CustomButton>(
                sf::Vector2f(100.0f, 300.0f),
                sf::Vector2f(200.0f, 50.0f),
                "600x1000", 30, sf::Color::White, "button.png", "Arial.ttf"
            ));
            s_generiqueButton.addButton(std::make_shared<Objet::CustomButton>(
                sf::Vector2f(100.0f, 400.0f),
                sf::Vector2f(200.0f, 50.0f),
                "800x1200", 30, sf::Color::White, "button.png", "Arial.ttf"
            ));
            s_generiqueButton.addButton(std::make_shared<Objet::CustomButton>(
                sf::Vector2f(100.0f, 500.0f),
                sf::Vector2f(200.0f, 50.0f),
                "1200x1800", 30, sf::Color::White, "button.png", "Arial.ttf"
            ));
            s_texts.emplace_back(std::make_unique<Objet::Text>(std::make_pair(100.0f, 150.0f), "Volume Settings", 30, sf::Color::White, "Arial.ttf"));
            s_generiqueButton.addButton(std::make_shared<Objet::SliderVolume>(
                100.0f, 100.0f, 200.0f, 20.0f, "SliderVolumeMusic"
            ));
            s_generiqueButton.addButton(std::make_shared<Objet::SliderVolume>(
                100.0f, 200.0f, 200.0f, 20.0f, "SliderVolumeSound"
            ));
        }

        void Setting::handleEvent(const sf::Event& event) {
            if (event.type == sf::Event::MouseButtonPressed && event.mouseButton.button == sf::Mouse::Left) {
                sf::Vector2i mousePosition(event.mouseButton.x, event.mouseButton.y);
                if (s_generiqueButton.isClicked(mousePosition)) {
                    for (const auto& button : s_generiqueButton.getButtons()) {
                        if (button->isClicked(mousePosition)) {
                            const std::string& label = button->getLabel();
                            if (label == "backButton") {
                                nextScene("menu");
                            }
                            break;
                        }
                    }
                }
            }
            if (event.type == sf::Event::MouseMoved || event.type == sf::Event::MouseButtonPressed) {
                for (const auto& button : s_generiqueButton.getButtons()) {
                    const std::string& label = button->getLabel();
                    if (label == "SliderVolumeMusic") {
                        button->update(*_window);
                        float volume = button->getVolume();
                        ResourceManager::updateMusicVolume("MenuMusic.wav", volume);
                    }
                    if (label == "SliderVolumeSound") {
                        button->update(*_window);
                        float volume = button->getVolume();
                        ResourceManager::updateAllSoundsVolume(volume);
                    }
                }
            }
        }

        void Setting::update(sf::Time dt) {
            s_generiqueButton.update(*_window);
        }

        void Setting::resize(sf::RenderWindow& window, const sf::Vector2u& baseSize) {
        }

        void Setting::render(sf::RenderWindow& window) {
            s_background->draw(window);
            s_generiqueButton.update(*_window);
            s_generiqueButton.draw(window);
            for (const auto& text : s_texts) {
                text->draw(window);
            }
        }

        void Setting::nextScene(const std::string& sceneName) {
            s_sceneManager.changeScene(sceneName);
        }
    }
}

/*
** EPITECH PROJECT, 2024
** ComponentManager
** File description:
** Component Manager
*/

#include "PlayerScript.hpp"

extern "C" ECS::PlayerScript *createScript()
{
    return new ECS::PlayerScript();
}

void ECS::PlayerScript::onStart()
{
    pos = Game->getComponent<ECS::Component::Position>(_selfID);
    cooldown = 0;
    state = NORMAL;
}

void ECS::PlayerScript::onUpdate()
{
    if (sf::Keyboard::isKeyPressed(sf::Keyboard::Space) && cooldown < 0)
    {
        if (state == BUFFED) {
            int id = Game->createEntityFromPrefab("bullet");
            Game->getComponent<ECS::Component::Velocity>(id)->y = -300;
            Game->getComponent<ECS::Component::Position>(id)->x = pos->x + 30;
            Game->getComponent<ECS::Component::Position>(id)->y = pos->y;
            id = Game->createEntityFromPrefab("bullet");
            Game->getComponent<ECS::Component::Position>(id)->x = pos->x + 30;
            Game->getComponent<ECS::Component::Position>(id)->y = pos->y;
            id = Game->createEntityFromPrefab("bullet");
            Game->getComponent<ECS::Component::Velocity>(id)->y = 300;
            Game->getComponent<ECS::Component::Position>(id)->x = pos->x + 30;
            Game->getComponent<ECS::Component::Position>(id)->y = pos->y;
            cooldown = 0.3f;
        } else {
            int id = Game->createEntityFromPrefab("bullet");
            Game->getComponent<ECS::Component::Position>(id)->x = pos->x + 30;
            Game->getComponent<ECS::Component::Position>(id)->y = pos->y;
            cooldown = 0.3f;
        }

    }
    cooldown -= Game->getDeltaTime();

}

void ECS::PlayerScript::onCollision(ECS::entity_id id)
{
    auto e = Game->getComponent<ECS::Component::Tag>(id);
    if (e != nullptr) {
        if (e->value == "power") {
            state = BUFFED;
            Game->destroyEntity(id);
        }
    }
}

{
    return new ECS::BulletScript();
}

void ECS::BulletScript::onStart()
{
    pos = Game->getComponent<ECS::Component::Position>(_selfID);
    vel = Game->getComponent<ECS::Component::Velocity>(_selfID);
    cooldown = 0;
}

void ECS::BulletScript::onUpdate()
{
    if (pos->x > 1700) {
        Game->destroyEntity(_selfID);
    }
}

void ECS::BulletScript::onCollision(ECS::entity_id id)
{
    auto e = Game->getComponent<ECS::Component::Tag>(id);
    if (e != nullptr) {
        if (e->value == "ennemy") {
            auto h = Game->getComponent<ECS::Component::Health>(id);
            if (h != nullptr) {
                h->health -= 1;
                if (h->health <= 0) {
                    auto enemy_pos = Game->getComponent<ECS::Component::Position>(id);
                    if (enemy_pos != nullptr) {
                        this->spawnPrefabAt("explosion_tm", enemy_pos->x, enemy_pos->y);
                    }
                    Game->destroyEntity(id);
                }
            }
            this->spawnPrefabAt("explosion", pos->x, pos->y);
            Game->destroyEntity(_selfID);
        }
    }
}

#include "AssetStorage.hpp"

void ECS::AssetStorage::init(std::string path)
{
    if (path.empty()) return;

    this->_defaultSprite = sf::Sprite();
    this->_defaultAudio = sf::Sound();

    for (const auto &entry : std::filesystem::directory_iterator(path + "/sprite")) {
        if (entry.path().extension() == ".png" || entry.path().extension() == ".jpg") {
            sf::Texture text;
            if (!text.loadFromFile(entry.path().string())) {
                std::cout << text.getSize().x << std::endl;
                continue;
            }
            text.setRepeated(true);
            this->_textures[entry.path().stem().string()] = text;
            this->_sprites[entry.path().stem().string()] = sf::Sprite(this->_textures[entry.path().stem().string()]);
        }
    }
    for (const auto &entry : std::filesystem::directory_iterator(path + "/audio")) {
        if (entry.path().extension() == ".mp3" || entry.path().extension() == ".ogg") {
            sf::SoundBuffer buffer;
            if (!buffer.loadFromFile(entry.path().string()))
                continue;
            sf::Sound newSound(buffer);
            this->_audio[entry.path().filename().string()] = newSound;
        }
    }
    for (const auto& entry : std::filesystem::directory_iterator(path + "/prefab")) {
        if (entry.is_regular_file() && entry.path().extension() == ".json") {
            std::string prefabName = entry.path().stem().string();
            loadPrefab(entry.path().string(), prefabName);
        }
    }
    for (const auto& entry : std::filesystem::directory_iterator(path + "/script")) {
        if (entry.path().extension() == ".so") {
            // Load the shared object
            void* handle = dlopen(entry.path().c_str(), RTLD_LAZY | RTLD_GLOBAL);
            if (!handle) {
                std::cerr << "Error loading shared object: " << dlerror() << std::endl;
                continue;
            }

            // Get the createScript function
            auto createScript = (ECS::IScript* (*)())dlsym(handle, "createScript");
            if (!createScript) {
                std::cerr << "Error finding symbol createScript: " << dlerror() << std::endl;
                dlclose(handle);
                continue;
            }

            // Store the script in the map using std::shared_ptr
            this->_scripts[entry.path().stem().string()] = [handle = handle, createScript]() -> std::shared_ptr<ECS::IScript> {
                return std::shared_ptr<ECS::IScript>(createScript());
            };
        }
    }

}

void ECS::AssetStorage::loadPrefab(const std::string& filePath, const std::string& prefabName)
{
    std::ifstream file(filePath);
    if (file.is_open()) {
        nlohmann::json prefabData;
        file >> prefabData;
        _prefabs[prefabName] = prefabData; // Store the prefab data by its name
    } else {
        std::cerr << "Failed to load prefab from file: " << filePath << std::endl;
    }
}

#ifndef ASSET_STORAGE_HPP_
    #define ASSET_STORAGE_HPP_

    #include <filesystem>
    #include <memory>
    #include <queue>
    #include <map>
    #include <unordered_map>
    #include <fstream>
    #include <dlfcn.h>
    #include <iostream>

    #include "json.hpp"
    #include "GUI_SFML_Graphics.hpp"
    #include "Component/Components.hpp"

    namespace ECS
    {
        /**
        * This singleton stores all of the avaliable ressources in the asset directory.
        * This includes sprites, audio, json prefabs and scripts
        * All of the ressource's key names correspond to the name of their files in the asset directory.
        * 
        * The asset directory's structure cannot be modified
        *
        */
        class AssetStorage {
            public:

                static AssetStorage& getInstance() {
                    static AssetStorage instance;
                    return instance;
                }

                /**
                * Called at the singleton's initiation, you don't need to reuse it unless you know what you're doing
                * @param path Path of the asset folder
                *
                */
                void init(std::string path);

                /**
                * Returns a sprite, returns an empty one if not found
                * @param key name of the sprite
                *
                * @return Sprite
                *
                */
                const sf::Sprite &getSprite(const std::string& key) const {
                    auto it = _sprites.find(key);
                    if (it != _sprites.end()) {
                        return it->second;
                    }
                    return _defaultSprite;
                }

                /**
                * Returns a sound, returns an empty one if not found
                * @param key name of the sound
                *
                * @return Sound
                *
                */
                const sf::Sound &getAudio(const std::string& key) const {
                    auto it = _audio.find(key);
                    if (it != _audio.end()) {
                        return it->second;
                    }
                    return _defaultAudio;
                }

                /**
                * Returns a prefab's json configuration, returns an empty one if not found
                * @param key name of the prefab
                *
                * @return Prefab's configuration
                * 
                * @warning This function should not necessarily be used as the engine already uses it in it's
                * regular methods. for any prefab call, refer to script's methods or ECSManager's methods
                *
                */
                const nlohmann::json& getPrefab(const std::string& key) const {
                    auto it = _prefabs.find(key);
                    if (it != _prefabs.end()) {
                        return it->second;
                    }
                    static nlohmann::json defaultJson;
                    return defaultJson; // Return empty json object if not found
                }

                /**
                * Returns a script wrapped in a shared_ptr, returns an nullptr if not found
                * @param key name of the script
                *
                * @return Script
                *
                * @warning This function should not necessarily be used as the engine already uses it in it's
                * regular methods. for any prefab call, refer to script's methods or ECSManager's methods
                *
                */
                std::shared_ptr<ECS::IScript> getScript(const std::string &key)
                {
                    if (_scripts.count(key) == 0) {
                        return nullptr;
                    }
                    auto s = _scripts[key]();
                    return s;
                }

            protected:
                // Private constructor to prevent creating multiple instances
                AssetStorage() {init("assets");};
                AssetStorage(const AssetStorage&) = delete;
                AssetStorage& operator=(const AssetStorage&) = delete;

                void loadPrefab(const std::string& filePath, const std::string& prefabName);

                // Private data members for storing the assets
                std::unordered_map<std::string, sf::Texture> _textures;
                std::unordered_map<std::string, sf::Sprite> _sprites;
                sf::Sprite _defaultSprite;
                std::unordered_map<std::string, sf::Sound> _audio;
                sf::Sound _defaultAudio;
                std::unordered_map<std::string, nlohmann::json> _prefabs;
                std::unordered_map<std::string, std::function<std::shared_ptr<ECS::IScript>()>> _scripts;
        };

        extern AssetStorage& ASSET_STORAGE;

    };

#endif

/*
** EPITECH PROJECT, 2024

** EntityManager Class

#ifndef COMPONENT_MANAGER_HPP_
    #define COMPONENT_MANAGER_HPP_

    #include <typeindex>
    #include <any>
    #include <iostream>
    #include <optional>
    #include <memory>
    #include <queue>
    #include <map>
    #include <unordered_map>

    #include "Entity.hpp"
    #include "Component/Components.hpp"
    #include "Component/ComponentStorage.hpp"

    namespace ECS
    {
        /**
        * Stores and Manages all of the components of all entities currently existing
        * The template "Component" corresponds to all of the structs avaliable in Components.hpp
        *
        */
        class ComponentManager {

            public:
                ComponentManager();

                /**
                * Add a component to an entity in the current world
                * @param id Entity ID
                * @tparam Component Component's struct which's values are setup or not
                *
                */
                template <typename Component>
                void addComponent(ECS::entity_id id, Component component) {
                    std::type_index index = typeid(Component);
                    if (this->_components.find(index) == this->_components.end()) {
                        this->registerComponentStorage<Component>();
                    }
                    auto& storage = getComponentStorage<Component>();
                    storage.add(id, std::move(std::make_shared<Component>(component)));
                    this->_entityWithComponent[index].push_back(id);
                }

                /**
                * Remove a component from an entity in the current world
                * @param id Entity ID
                * @tparam Component Component's struct
                *
                * @warning It should be called like this: removeComponent<ComponentStructType>(id)
                *
                */
                template <typename Component>
                void removeComponent(ECS::entity_id id) {
                    std::type_index index = typeid(Component);
                    auto& storage = getComponentStorage<Component>();
                    storage.remove(id);
                    this->_entityWithComponent[index].erase(std::remove(this->_entityWithComponent[index].begin(), this->_entityWithComponent[index].end(), id), this->_entityWithComponent[index].end());
                }

                /**
                * Remove all of the components from an entity
                * @param id Entity ID
                *
                */
                void removeAllComponents(ECS::entity_id id)
                {
                    for (auto &e : this->_components) {
                        this->_components[e.first]->remove(id);
                        this->_entityWithComponent[e.first].erase(std::remove(this->_entityWithComponent[e.first].begin(), this->_entityWithComponent[e.first].end(), id), this->_entityWithComponent[e.first].end());
                    }
                }

                /**
                * Get a component from an entity in the current world, you can then modify the shared_ptr component
                * to directly modify it's information inside the entity, no need to re-add it
                * @param id Entity ID
                * @tparam Component Component's struct
                * 
                * @warning It should be called like this: getComponent<ComponentStructType>(id)
                * 
                * @return Entity's component wrapped in a shared_ptr
                *
                */
                template <typename Component>
                std::optional<std::shared_ptr<Component>> getComponent(ECS::entity_id id) {
                    return getComponentStorage<Component>().get(id);
                }

                template <typename Component>
                std::shared_ptr<ComponentStorage<Component>> getComponents() {
                    return getComponentStorage<Component>();
                }

                /**
                * Returns a list of all the entities that have a component type, usefull when you create a System
                * or want to know only certain entities to increase performance
                * @tparam Component Component's struct
                * 
                * @warning It should be called like this: getEntitiesWithComponent<ComponentStructType>()
                *
                */
                template <typename Component>
                std::vector<ECS::entity_id> getEntitiesWithComponent()
                {
                    return _entityWithComponent[typeid(Component)];
                }

                /**
                * Returns the component storage of a component type
                * @tparam Component Component's struct
                * 
                * @warning It should be called like this: getComponentStorage<ComponentStructType>(id)
                * 
                * @return Entity's component Storage
                *
                */
                template <typename Component>
                ComponentStorage<Component>& getComponentStorage() {
                    if (_components.count(typeid(Component)) == 0) {
                        this->registerComponentStorage<Component>();
                    }
                    return *static_cast<ComponentStorage<Component>*>(_components[typeid(Component)].get());
                }

                template <typename Component>
                void registerComponentStorage() {
                    _components[typeid(Component)] = std::make_shared<ComponentStorage<Component>>();
                }

            private:
                std::unordered_map<std::type_index, std::vector<ECS::entity_id>> _entityWithComponent;
                std::unordered_map<std::type_index, std::shared_ptr<ComponentStorageBase>> _components;
        };
    }

#endif

#include "ECSManager.hpp"
#include "ErrorException.hpp"
#include <iostream>
#include <fstream>

ECS::ECSManager::ECSManager(const std::string &name, const bool &isGraphic, const bool &isLogic, std::shared_ptr<sf::RenderWindow> preparedWindow)
{
    this->_currentRegistry = nullptr;
    this->_systemManager = std::make_unique<SystemManager>();
    if (isGraphic) {
        if (preparedWindow == nullptr) {
            this->_win = std::make_shared<sf::RenderWindow>(sf::VideoMode(1600, 900), name);
        } else {
            this->_win = preparedWindow;
        }
        this->_win->setFramerateLimit(60);
        this->addSystem<ECS::System::Animate>();
        this->addSystem<ECS::System::ParallaxSystem>();
        this->addSystem<ECS::System::Draw>(this->_win);
        this->addSystem<ECS::System::PlayerControl>(this->_win);
        this->addSystem<ECS::System::ScriptOnClick>(this->_win);
    }
    if (isLogic) {
        this->addSystem<ECS::System::Movement>();
        this->addSystem<ECS::System::Collision>();
        this->addSystem<ECS::System::PlayerMovement>();
        this->addSystem<ECS::System::ScriptUpdate>();
    }

    this->_jsonToComp["Position"] = [this](nlohmann::json j, ECS::entity_id id) -> void {
        ECS::Component::Position comp;
        comp.x = this->get_json_value<int>(j, "x");
        comp.y = this->get_json_value<int>(j, "y");
        this->addComponent(id, comp);
    };

    this->_jsonToComp["Velocity"] = [this](nlohmann::json j, ECS::entity_id id) -> void {
        ECS::Component::Velocity comp;
        comp.x = this->get_json_value<int>(j, "x");
        comp.y = this->get_json_value<int>(j, "y");
        this->addComponent(id, comp);
    };

    this->_jsonToComp["Acceleration"] = [this](nlohmann::json j, ECS::entity_id id) -> void {
        ECS::Component::Acceleration comp;
        comp.x = this->get_json_value<int>(j, "x");
        comp.y = this->get_json_value<int>(j, "y");
        this->addComponent(id, comp);
    };

    this->_jsonToComp["Hitbox"] = [this](nlohmann::json j, ECS::entity_id id) -> void {
        ECS::Component::Hitbox comp;
        comp.x = this->get_json_value<int>(j, "x");
        comp.y = this->get_json_value<int>(j, "y");
        comp.w = this->get_json_value<int>(j, "w");
        comp.h = this->get_json_value<int>(j, "h");
        this->addComponent(id, comp);
    };

    this->_jsonToComp["State"] = [this](nlohmann::json j, ECS::entity_id id) -> void {
        ECS::Component::State comp;
        comp.value = this->get_json_value<std::string>(j, "value");
        this->addComponent(id, comp);
    };

    this->_jsonToComp["Tag"] = [this](nlohmann::json j, ECS::entity_id id) -> void {
        ECS::Component::Tag comp;
        comp.value = this->get_json_value<std::string>(j, "value");
        this->addComponent(id, comp);
    };

    this->_jsonToComp["Script"] = [this](nlohmann::json j, ECS::entity_id id) -> void {
        ECS::Component::Script comp;
        comp.content = ECS::AssetStorage::getInstance().getScript(this->get_json_value<std::string>(j, "name"));
        comp.content->setEcsManager(this);
        comp.content->setEntityID(id);
        this->addComponent(id, comp);
    };

    this->_jsonToComp["Drawable"] = [this](nlohmann::json j, ECS::entity_id id) -> void {
        ECS::Component::Drawable comp;
        comp.sprite = ECS::AssetStorage::getInstance().getSprite(this->get_json_value<std::string>(j, "sprite"));
        comp.center = this->get_json_value<bool>(j, "center");
        this->addComponent(id, comp);
    };

    this->_jsonToComp["Animation"] = [this](nlohmann::json j, ECS::entity_id id) -> void {
        ECS::Component::Animation comp;
        comp.rect.left = 0;
        comp.rect.top = 0;
        comp.rect.width = this->get_json_value<int>(j, "w");
        comp.rect.height = this->get_json_value<int>(j, "h");
        comp.fps = this->get_json_value<int>(j, "fps");
        comp.destroyAtEnd = this->get_json_value<bool>(j, "destroy");
        this->addComponent(id, comp);
    };

    this->_jsonToComp["Parallax"] = [this](nlohmann::json j, ECS::entity_id id) -> void {
        ECS::Component::Parallax comp;
        comp.speed = this->get_json_value<int>(j, "speed");
        this->addComponent(id, comp);
    };

    this->_jsonToComp["Health"] = [this](nlohmann::json j, ECS::entity_id id) -> void {
        ECS::Component::Health comp;
        comp.health = this->get_json_value<int>(j, "health");
        this->addComponent(id, comp);
    };

    this->_jsonToComp["PlayerInput"] = [this](nlohmann::json j, ECS::entity_id id) -> void {
        this->addComponent(id, ECS::Component::PlayerInput());
    };
}

ECS::ECSManager::~ECSManager()
{
    for (auto &world : this->worlds) {
        for (auto &entity : world.second->getAllEntities()) {
            world.second->removeAllComponents(entity);
        }
    }
}

void ECS::ECSManager::createWorld(const std::string& worldName)
{
    worlds[worldName] = std::make_shared<Registry>();
    _currentRegistry = worlds[worldName];
}

void ECS::ECSManager::changeWorld(const std::string& worldName)
{
    if (worlds.count(worldName) != 0) {
        _currentRegistry = worlds[worldName];
    }
}

void ECS::ECSManager::loadWorld(const std::string& filePath)
{
    std::ifstream file(filePath);
    if (!file.is_open()) {
        std::cerr << "Failed to open world file: " << filePath << std::endl;
        return;
    }
    nlohmann::json worldData;
    file >> worldData;
    std::string worldName = worldData.value("name", "default_world");
    this->createWorld(worldName);
    this->loadEntitiesFromJson(worldData);
}

void ECS::ECSManager::loadEntitiesFromJson(const nlohmann::json& worldData)
{
    const auto& entities = worldData["entities"];
    for (const auto& entityData : entities) {
        std::string prefabName = entityData["prefab"];
        if (entityData.contains("components")) {
            instantiatePrefab(prefabName, entityData["components"]);
        } else {
            instantiatePrefab(prefabName, nlohmann::json{});
        }
    }
}

ECS::entity_id ECS::ECSManager::instantiatePrefab(const std::string& prefabName, const nlohmann::json& overrideData)
{
    // Retrieve the prefab from AssetStorage
    const nlohmann::json& prefabData = AssetStorage::getInstance().getPrefab(prefabName);
    if (prefabData.empty()) {
        std::cerr << "Prefab " << prefabName << " not found!" << std::endl;
        return -1;
    }
    // Create the entity
    entity_id id = this->_currentRegistry->createEntity();
    // Apply components from prefab, allowing overrides from overrideData
    for (const auto& compData : prefabData.items()) {
        const std::string& componentName = compData.key();
        nlohmann::json componentValues = compData.value();
        // Check for override data
        if (!overrideData.empty() && overrideData.contains(componentName)) {
            componentValues.merge_patch(overrideData[componentName]);
        }
        if (_jsonToComp.count(componentName) != 0) {
            this->_jsonToComp[componentName](componentValues, id);
        }
    }
    return id;
}

void ECS::ECSManager::runSystems()
{
    if (_currentRegistry) {
        _systemManager->runAllSystems(*_currentRegistry);
    }
}

void ECS::ECSManager::run()
{
    if (this->_win != nullptr) {
        this->windowLoop();
    } else {
        while (true) {
            this->runSystems();
            this->_dt = this->_systemManager->getDeltaTime();
        }
    }
}

void ECS::ECSManager::windowLoop()
{
    sf::Event event;
    int n = 1;
    while (this->_win->isOpen()) {
        this->_win->clear();
        while (this->_win->pollEvent(event))
        {
            if (event.type == sf::Event::Closed) {
                this->_win->close();
            }
        }
        this->runSystems();
        this->_dt = this->_systemManager->getDeltaTime();
        this->_win->display();
    }
}

ECS::Registry& ECS::ECSManager::getCurrentRegistry()
{
    if (!_currentRegistry) {
        throw ErrorException("No world loaded.");
    }
    return *_currentRegistry;
}

const ECS::entity_id &ECS::ECSManager::createEntity()
{
    return this->getCurrentRegistry().createEntity();
}

ECS::entity_id ECS::ECSManager::createEntityFromPrefab(const std::string& prefabName)
{
    return this->instantiatePrefab(prefabName, nlohmann::json{});
}

void ECS::ECSManager::destroyEntity(const entity_id &id)
{
    this->getCurrentRegistry().destroyEntity(id);
    this->getCurrentRegistry().removeAllComponents(id);
}

std::shared_ptr<sf::RenderWindow> ECS::ECSManager::getWindow()
{
    return this->_win;
}

const double &ECS::ECSManager::getDeltaTime()
{
    return this->_dt;
}

/*

#ifndef ECSMANAGER_HPP_
    #define ECSMANAGER_HPP_

    #include <memory>
    #include <unordered_map>
    #include <string>
    #include <vector>

    #include "Registry.hpp"
    #include "SystemManager.hpp"
    #include "AssetStorage.hpp"

namespace ECS {

    /**
    * This class manages the entire engine.
    * This is the class that is passed to scripts to be able to modify the game at will.
    * It is also the one managing and executing the registry (component and entity manager) as well as the systems
    * It is also responsible for json parsing as well as world management.
    *
    */
    class ECSManager {

        public:
            /**
            * Create the engine's class that manages all the worlds and systems.
            * @param name Name of the game you create (the name of the window)
            * @param isGraphic Enables the window and graphic systems (Drawable, animate, parallax, etc)
            * @param isLogic Enables the logic systems (collisions, scripts, etc)
            * @param preparedWindow shared_ptr to a window you setup that overrides the default one. It is not necessary
            *
            */
            ECSManager(const std::string &name = "Game", const bool &isGraphic = true, const bool &isLogic = true, std::shared_ptr<sf::RenderWindow> preparedWindow = nullptr);
            ~ECSManager();

            /**
            * Create an empty world with a name
            * @param path Name of the world to create
            *
            */
            void createWorld(const std::string& worldName);

            /**
            * Changes the currently active world
            * @param worldName name of the world
            *
            */
            void changeWorld(const std::string& worldName);

            /**
            * Load a world from a configuration file
            * @param path Path of the world's configuration file
            *
            */
            void loadWorld(const std::string& filePath);

            /**
            * Runs all of the systems at once
            *
            */
            void runSystems();

            /**
            * Launches the game engine's loop
            *
            */
            void run();

            /**
            * Returns the current world's registry
            * @return Current registry of the world
            *
            */
            Registry& getCurrentRegistry();

            /**
            * Create an empty entity in the current world
            *
            * @return ID of the created entity
            */
            const ECS::entity_id &createEntity();

            /**
            * Create an entity from a prefab in the AssetStorage singleton
            * @param prefabName name of the prefab
            * 
            * @return ID of the created entity
            *
            */
            ECS::entity_id createEntityFromPrefab(const std::string& prefabName);

            /**
            * Destroy an entity in the current world
            * @param id Entity ID to destroy
            *
            */
            void destroyEntity(const entity_id &id);

            /**
            * Returns the used window's pointer wrapped in a shared::ptr
            *
            * @return SFML window
            */
            std::shared_ptr<sf::RenderWindow> getWindow();

            /**
            * Returns elaped time this frame in seconds
            * @return Elapsed time
            *
            */
            const double &getDeltaTime();

            /**
            * Create a world from a world configuration
            * @tparam System Struct of the system
            * @tparam Args Arguments required by the system at initialisation (usually the window)
            *
            */
            template <typename System, typename... Args>
            void addSystem(Args&&... args)
            {
                this->_systemManager->addSystem<System>(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
            }

            /**
            * Add a component to an entity in the current world
            * @param id Entity ID
            * @tparam Component Component's struct which's values are setup or not
            *
            */
            template <typename Component>
            void addComponent(entity_id id, Component comp)
            {
                this->getCurrentRegistry().addComponent(id, comp);
            }

            /**
            * Remove a component from an entity in the current world
            * @param id Entity ID
            * @tparam Component Component's struct
            * 
            * @warning It should be called like this: removeComponent<ComponentStructType>(id)
            *
            */
            template <typename Component>
            void removeComponent(entity_id id)
            {
                this->getCurrentRegistry().removeComponent<Component>(id);
            }

            /**
            * Get a component from an entity in the current world, you can then modify the shared_ptr component
            * to directly modify it's information inside the entity, no need to re-add it
            * @param id Entity ID
            * @tparam Component Component's struct
            * 
            * @warning It should be called like this: getComponent<ComponentStructType>(id)
            * 
            * @return Entity's component wrapped in a shared_ptr
            *
            */
            template <typename Component>
            std::shared_ptr<Component> getComponent(entity_id id)
            {
                return this->getCurrentRegistry().getComponent<Component>(id);
            }

            /**
            * Returns a list of all the entities that have a component type, usefull when you create a System
            * or want to know only certain entities to increase performance
            * @tparam Component Component's struct
            * 
            * @warning It should be called like this: getEntitiesWithComponent<ComponentStructType>()
            *
            */
            template <typename Component>
            std::vector<entity_id> getEntitiesWithComponent()
            {
                return this->getCurrentRegistry().getEntitiesWithComponent<Component>();
            }

        private:
            std::shared_ptr<sf::RenderWindow> _win;
            double _dt;

            std::unordered_map<std::string, std::shared_ptr<Registry>> worlds;
            std::unique_ptr<SystemManager> _systemManager;
            std::shared_ptr<Registry> _currentRegistry;

            std::unordered_map<std::string, std::function<void(nlohmann::json, ECS::entity_id)>> _jsonToComp;

            void loadEntitiesFromJson(const nlohmann::json& worldData);
            ECS::entity_id instantiatePrefab(const std::string& prefabName, const nlohmann::json& overrideData);
            void windowLoop();

            template <typename T>
            T get_json_value(const nlohmann::json& j, const std::string& key) {
                if (j.contains(key)) {
                    return j[key].get<T>();
                } else {
                    return T();
                }
            }
        };

    }

#endif

    {
        using entity_id = std::size_t;

        /**
        * The definition of an entity, it is convertable to size_t
        *
        */
        class Entity {

            public:
                // Explicit constructor to prevent implicit construction from size_t

                // Implicit conversion operator to size_t
                operator size_t() const { return _id; }

            protected:

/*
** EPITECH PROJECT, 2024
** EpiGimp
** File description:
** main
*/

#include <iostream>
#include "EntityManager.hpp"

ECS::EntityManager::EntityManager()
{
    for (ECS::entity_id id = 0; id < ECS_MAX_ENTITY; id++) {
        this->_emptyIDs.push(id);
    }
}

const ECS::entity_id &ECS::EntityManager::createEntity()
{
    const ECS::entity_id &newID = this->_emptyIDs.front();
    this->_emptyIDs.pop();

    ECS::Entity newEntity(newID);
    this->_entities[newID] = newEntity;
    return newID;
}

void ECS::EntityManager::destroyEntity(const ECS::entity_id &id)
{
    this->_emptyIDs.push(id);
    this->_entities[id].reset();

}

std::vector<ECS::entity_id> ECS::EntityManager::getAllEntities()
{
    std::vector<ECS::entity_id> list;
    for (auto &e : this->_entities) {
        list.push_back(e.first);
    }

    return list;
}

/*
** EPITECH PROJECT, 2024
** RType
** File description:
** EntityManager Class
*/

#ifndef REGISTRY_HPP_
    #define REGISTRY_HPP_

    #include <memory>

    #include "EntityManager.hpp"
    #include "ComponentManager.hpp"

    namespace ECS
    {
        /**
        * Mediator that wraps Component and Entity manager, this should be where you
        * manipulate a world's content. It also contains all the entities of the world.
        *
        */
        class Registry {

            public:
                Registry()
                {
                    this->_entityManager = std::make_unique<ECS::EntityManager>();
                    this->_componentManager = std::make_unique<ECS::ComponentManager>();
                }

                ~Registry()
                {
                    std::vector<ECS::entity_id> allEntities = this->_entityManager->getAllEntities();
                    for (auto &e : allEntities) {
                        this->removeAllComponents(e);
                        this->destroyEntity(e);
                    }
                }

                const ECS::entity_id &createEntity()
                {
                    return this->_entityManager->createEntity();
                }

                void destroyEntity(const entity_id &id)
                {
                    this->_entityManager->destroyEntity(id);
                    this->removeAllComponents(id);
                }

                std::vector<ECS::entity_id> getAllEntities()
                {
                    return this->_entityManager->getAllEntities();
                }

                template <typename Component>
                void addComponent(ECS::entity_id id, Component comp)
                {
                    this->_componentManager->addComponent(id, comp);
                }

                template <typename Component>
                void removeComponent(ECS::entity_id id)
                {
                    this->_componentManager->removeComponent<Component>(id);
                }

                void removeAllComponents(ECS::entity_id id)
                {
                    this->_componentManager->removeAllComponents(id);
                }

                template <typename Component>
                std::shared_ptr<Component> getComponent(ECS::entity_id id)
                {
                    std::optional<std::shared_ptr<Component>> comp = this->_componentManager->getComponent<Component>(id);
                    if (comp == std::nullopt) {
                        return nullptr;
                    }
                    return comp.value();
                }

                template <typename Component>
                std::vector<ECS::entity_id> getEntitiesWithComponent()
                {
                    return this->_componentManager->getEntitiesWithComponent<Component>();
                }

                template <typename Component>
                ComponentStorage<Component> getComponents() {
                    // auto& storage = getComponentStorage<Component>();
                    return this->_componentManager->getComponentStorage<Component>();
                }


            private:
                std::unique_ptr<ECS::ComponentManager> _componentManager;
                std::unique_ptr<ECS::EntityManager> _entityManager;

        };
    }

#endif

#include "SystemManager.hpp"

ECS::SystemManager::SystemManager()
{

}

ECS::SystemManager::~SystemManager()
{

}

void ECS::SystemManager::runAllSystems(ECS::Registry &R)
{
    this->_dt = this->_clock.getElapsedTime().asSeconds();

    for (auto &system : this->_systems) {
        system(R, _dt);
    }
    this->_clock.restart();
}

double ECS::SystemManager::getDeltaTime()
{
    return this->_dt;
}

/*
** EPITECH PROJECT, 2024
** RType
** File description:
** SystemManager Class
*/

#ifndef SYSTEM_MANAGER_HPP_
    #define SYSTEM_MANAGER_HPP_

    #include <memory>
    #include <functional>
    #include <chrono>
    #include <cmath>

    #include "Systems.hpp"
    #include "Registry.hpp"

    namespace ECS
    {
        /**
        * Responsible for running and adding systems that are active during the execution
        * It also keeps track of the deltaTime between frames
        *
        */
        class SystemManager {

            public:
                SystemManager();
                ~SystemManager();

                template <typename System, typename... Args>
                void addSystem(Args&&... args)
                {
                    // Capture the arguments by reference to respect const correctness
                    this->_systems.push_back([&args...](ECS::Registry& R, double dt) {
                        // Forward the arguments to the system constructor
                        System system(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
                        system(R, dt);  // Call operator() on the system
                    });
                }

                void runAllSystems(ECS::Registry &R);
                double getDeltaTime();


            private:
                std::vector<std::function<void(ECS::Registry&, double dt)>> _systems;
                // std::chrono::steady_clock::time_point _lastTime;
                sf::Clock _clock;
                double _dt = 0;

        };
    }

#endif

docs.title: Systems.hpp
docs.text:
/*
** EPITECH PROJECT, 2024
** RType
** File description:
** ECS Components
*/

#ifndef SYSTEMS_HPP_
    #define SYSTEMS_HPP_

    #include <iostream>
    #include "GUI_SFML_Graphics.hpp"

    #include "Registry.hpp"

    namespace ECS::System
    {

        /**
        * Manages all the entities movement by adding their velocity to their position.
        *
        */
        struct Movement {

            void operator()(ECS::Registry &R, double dt)
            {
                std::vector<ECS::entity_id> allEntities = R.getEntitiesWithComponent<ECS::Component::Velocity>();
                for (auto &entity : allEntities) {
                    auto pos = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::Position>(entity);
                    auto vel = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::Velocity>(entity);
                    if (vel != nullptr) {
                        pos->x += (vel->x * dt);
                        pos->y += (vel->y * dt);
                    }
                }
            }
        };

        /**
        * Manages the collisions between entities and execute their's scripts "onCollision()" method if they do
        *
        */
        struct Collision {

            bool checkCollision(const ECS::Component::Hitbox &a, const ECS::Component::Hitbox &b) {
                return !(a.x + a.w < b.x || a.x > b.x + b.w || a.y + a.h < b.y || a.y > b.y + b.h);
            }

            void operator()(ECS::Registry &R, double dt)
            {
                std::vector<ECS::entity_id> allEntities = R.getEntitiesWithComponent<ECS::Component::Hitbox>();
                ECS::Component::Hitbox a;
                ECS::Component::Hitbox b;

                for (size_t i = 0; i < allEntities.size(); ++i) {
                    auto &entity = allEntities[i];
                    auto aHitbox = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::Hitbox>(entity);
                    auto aPos = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::Position>(entity);

                    if (aPos == nullptr) {
                        continue;
                    }

                    a = *aHitbox;
                    a.x += aPos->x;
                    a.y += aPos->y;

                    // Only check entities that come after the current one to avoid double-checking pairs
                    for (size_t j = i + 1; j < allEntities.size(); ++j) {
                        auto &otherEntity = allEntities[j];
                        auto bHitbox = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::Hitbox>(otherEntity);
                        auto bPos = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::Position>(otherEntity);

                        if (bPos == nullptr) {
                            continue;
                        }

                        b = *bHitbox;
                        b.x += bPos->x;
                        b.y += bPos->y;

                        if (checkCollision(a, b)) {
                            auto script_one = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::Script>(entity);
                            auto script_two = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::Script>(otherEntity);
                            if (script_one != nullptr) {
                                script_one->content->onCollision(otherEntity);
                            }
                            if (script_two != nullptr) {
                                script_two->content->onCollision(entity);
                            }
                        }
                    }
                }
            }
        };

        /**
        * Executes all active script's "onUpdate()" and "onStart()" methods.
        *
        */
        struct ScriptUpdate {

            void operator()(ECS::Registry &R, double dt) {
                std::vector<ECS::entity_id> allEntities = R.getEntitiesWithComponent<ECS::Component::Script>();

                for (auto &entity : allEntities) {
                    auto s = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::Script>(entity);

                    if (s != nullptr) {
                        if (!s->hasStarted) {
                            s->content->onStart();
                            s->hasStarted = true;
                        }
                        s->content->onUpdate();
                    }
                }
            }
        };

        /**
        * Executes the entity's "onClick()" method when the mouse clicks on it.
        *
        * @param _win the engine's window.
        * @param mousePos Mouse position value, it is modified each frame.
        */
        struct ScriptOnClick {

            std::shared_ptr<sf::RenderWindow> _win;
            sf::Vector2i mousePos;

            bool checkCollision(std::shared_ptr<ECS::Component::Hitbox> rect, float pointX, float pointY) {
                return !(pointX < rect->x || pointX > rect->x + rect->w || pointY < rect->y || pointY > rect->y + rect->h);
            }

            ScriptOnClick( std::shared_ptr<sf::RenderWindow>& winPtr) : _win(winPtr) {}

            void operator()(ECS::Registry &R, double dt) {
                std::vector<ECS::entity_id> allEntities = R.getEntitiesWithComponent<ECS::Component::Script>();

                mousePos = sf::Mouse::getPosition(*_win);

                for (auto &entity : allEntities) {
                    auto s = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::Script>(entity);
                    auto h = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::Hitbox>(entity);

                    if (s != nullptr && h != nullptr) {
                        if (checkCollision(h, sf::Mouse::getPosition().x, sf::Mouse::getPosition().y)
                            && sf::Mouse::isButtonPressed(sf::Mouse::Left)) {
                            s->content->onClick();
                        }
                    }
                }
            }
        };

        /**
        * Render's all active Drawable components on the window
        *
        * @param _win the engine's window.
        */
        struct Draw {

            std::shared_ptr<sf::RenderWindow> _win;

            Draw( std::shared_ptr<sf::RenderWindow>& winPtr) : _win(winPtr) {}

            void operator()(ECS::Registry &R, double dt)
            {
                std::vector<ECS::entity_id> allEntities = R.getEntitiesWithComponent<ECS::Component::Drawable>();
                for (auto &entity : allEntities) {
                    auto pos = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::Position>(entity);
                    auto drawable = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::Drawable>(entity);
                    if (pos != nullptr) {
                        if (drawable->center) {
                            sf::Vector2f origin((float)drawable->sprite.getTextureRect().width / 2, (float)drawable->sprite.getTextureRect().height / 2);
                            drawable->sprite.setOrigin(origin);
                        }
                        drawable->sprite.setPosition(pos->x, pos->y);
                        _win->draw(drawable->sprite);
                    }
                }
            }
        };


        /**
        * Manages the entities's animation component and apply it to their drawable
        *
        */
        struct Animate {

            void operator()(ECS::Registry &R, double dt)
            {
                std::vector<ECS::entity_id> allEntities = R.getEntitiesWithComponent<ECS::Component::Animation>();
                sf::Vector2u size;
                for (auto &entity : allEntities) {
                    auto anim = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::Animation>(entity);
                    auto drawable = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::Drawable>(entity);
                    if (drawable != nullptr) {
                        anim->currentFps++;
                        if (!anim->animating) {
                            anim->animating = true;
                            drawable->sprite.setTextureRect(anim->rect);
                            sf::Vector2f origin((float)anim->rect.width / 2, (float)anim->rect.height / 2);
                            drawable->sprite.setOrigin(origin);
                            continue;
                        }
                        if (anim->currentFps < anim->fps) {
                            continue;
                        }
                        anim->currentFps = 0;
                        size = drawable->sprite.getTexture()->getSize();
                        anim->rect.left += anim->rect.width;
                        if (anim->rect.left >= size.x) {
                            if (anim->destroyAtEnd) {
                                R.destroyEntity(entity);
                                continue;
                            }
                            anim->rect.left = 0;
                        }
                        drawable->sprite.setTextureRect(anim->rect);
                    }
                }
            }
        };


        /**
        * Manages the entities's parallax component and apply it to their drawable
        *
        * This cannot be used with an animation component.
        *
        */
        struct ParallaxSystem {

            void operator()(ECS::Registry &R, double dt)
            {
                // Get all entities with a Parallax component
                std::vector<ECS::entity_id> allEntities = R.getEntitiesWithComponent<ECS::Component::Parallax>();
                sf::IntRect newRect;

                // Iterate over all entities with a Parallax component
                for (auto &entity : allEntities) {
                    auto parallax = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::Parallax>(entity);
                    auto drawable = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::Drawable>(entity);

                    if (drawable != nullptr && parallax != nullptr) {
                        newRect = drawable->sprite.getTextureRect();
                        newRect.left += parallax->speed;
                        if (newRect.left > newRect.width) {
                            newRect.left = 0;
                        }
                        drawable->sprite.setTextureRect(newRect);
                    }
                }
            }
        };

        /**
        * Debug Tool to manage local control for entities
        *
        */
        struct PlayerControl {

            std::shared_ptr<sf::RenderWindow> _win;
            sf::Event event;

            PlayerControl( std::shared_ptr<sf::RenderWindow>& winPtr) : _win(winPtr) {}

            void operator()(ECS::Registry &R, double dt)
            {
                std::vector<ECS::entity_id> allEntities = R.getEntitiesWithComponent<ECS::Component::PlayerInput>();
                for (auto &entity : allEntities) {
                    auto inputs = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::PlayerInput>(entity);
                    inputs->action = sf::Keyboard::isKeyPressed(sf::Keyboard::Space);
                    inputs->left = sf::Keyboard::isKeyPressed(sf::Keyboard::Left);
                    inputs->up = sf::Keyboard::isKeyPressed(sf::Keyboard::Up);
                    inputs->down = sf::Keyboard::isKeyPressed(sf::Keyboard::Down);
                    inputs->right = sf::Keyboard::isKeyPressed(sf::Keyboard::Right);
                }
            }
        };

        /**
        * Debug Tool to manage local movement for entities based on Debug Movement
        *
        */
        struct PlayerMovement {

            void operator()(ECS::Registry &R, double dt)
            {
                std::vector<ECS::entity_id> allEntities = R.getEntitiesWithComponent<ECS::Component::PlayerInput>();
                for (auto &entity : allEntities) {
                    auto inputs = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::PlayerInput>(entity);
                    auto vel = R.getComponent<ECS::Component::Velocity>(entity);
                    if (vel) {
                        vel->x = (inputs->left * -300) + (inputs->right * 300);
                        vel->y = (inputs->up * -300) + (inputs->down * 300);
                    }
                }
            }
        };

    }

#endif

#ifndef INCLUDE_NLOHMANN_JSON_HPP_

#include <algorithm> // all_of, find, for_each

namespace detail
{

template<typename ...Ts> struct make_void
{
    using type = void;
};
template<typename ...Ts> using void_t = typename make_void<Ts...>::type;

}  // namespace detail
NLOHMANN_JSON_NAMESPACE_END


NLOHMANN_JSON_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
namespace detail
{

// https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/experimental/is_detected
struct nonesuch
{
    nonesuch() = delete;
    ~nonesuch() = delete;
    nonesuch(nonesuch const&) = delete;
    nonesuch(nonesuch const&&) = delete;
    void operator=(nonesuch const&) = delete;
    void operator=(nonesuch&&) = delete;
};

template<class Default,
         class AlwaysVoid,
         template<class...> class Op,
         class... Args>
struct detector
{
    using value_t = std::false_type;
    using type = Default;
};

template<class Default, template<class...> class Op, class... Args>
struct detector<Default, void_t<Op<Args...>>, Op, Args...>
{
    using value_t = std::true_type;
    using type = Op<Args...>;
};

template<template<class...> class Op, class... Args>
using is_detected = typename detector<nonesuch, void, Op, Args...>::value_t;

template<template<class...> class Op, class... Args>
struct is_detected_lazy : is_detected<Op, Args...> { };

template<template<class...> class Op, class... Args>
using detected_t = typename detector<nonesuch, void, Op, Args...>::type;

template<class Default, template<class...> class Op, class... Args>
using detected_or = detector<Default, void, Op, Args...>;

template<class Default, template<class...> class Op, class... Args>
using detected_or_t = typename detected_or<Default, Op, Args...>::type;

template<class Expected, template<class...> class Op, class... Args>
using is_detected_exact = std::is_same<Expected, detected_t<Op, Args...>>;

template<class To, template<class...> class Op, class... Args>
using is_detected_convertible =
    std::is_convertible<detected_t<Op, Args...>, To>;

}  // namespace detail
NLOHMANN_JSON_NAMESPACE_END

// This file contains all internal macro definitions (except those affecting ABI)
// You MUST include macro_unscope.hpp at the end of json.hpp to undef all of them

// #include <nlohmann/detail/abi_macros.hpp>


// exclude unsupported compilers
#if !defined(JSON_SKIP_UNSUPPORTED_COMPILER_CHECK)
    #if defined(__clang__)
        #if (__clang_major__ * 10000 + __clang_minor__ * 100 + __clang_patchlevel__) < 30400
            #error "unsupported Clang version - see https://github.com/nlohmann/json#supported-compilers"
        #endif
    #elif defined(__GNUC__) && !(defined(__ICC) || defined(__INTEL_COMPILER))
        #if (__GNUC__ * 10000 + __GNUC_MINOR__ * 100 + __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__) < 40800
            #error "unsupported GCC version - see https://github.com/nlohmann/json#supported-compilers"
        #endif
    #endif
#endif

// C++ language standard detection
// if the user manually specified the used c++ version this is skipped
#if !defined(JSON_HAS_CPP_20) && !defined(JSON_HAS_CPP_17) && !defined(JSON_HAS_CPP_14) && !defined(JSON_HAS_CPP_11)
    #if (defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 202002L) || (defined(_MSVC_LANG) && _MSVC_LANG >= 202002L)
        #define JSON_HAS_CPP_20
        #define JSON_HAS_CPP_17
        #define JSON_HAS_CPP_14
    #elif (defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201703L) || (defined(_HAS_CXX17) && _HAS_CXX17 == 1) // fix for issue #464
        #define JSON_HAS_CPP_17
        #define JSON_HAS_CPP_14
    #elif (defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201402L) || (defined(_HAS_CXX14) && _HAS_CXX14 == 1)
        #define JSON_HAS_CPP_14
    #endif
    // the cpp 11 flag is always specified because it is the minimal required version
    #define JSON_HAS_CPP_11
#endif

#ifdef __has_include
    #if __has_include(<version>)
        #include <version>
    #endif
#endif

#if !defined(JSON_HAS_FILESYSTEM) && !defined(JSON_HAS_EXPERIMENTAL_FILESYSTEM)
    #ifdef JSON_HAS_CPP_17
        #if defined(__cpp_lib_filesystem)
            #define JSON_HAS_FILESYSTEM 1
        #elif defined(__cpp_lib_experimental_filesystem)
            #define JSON_HAS_EXPERIMENTAL_FILESYSTEM 1
        #elif !defined(__has_include)
            #define JSON_HAS_EXPERIMENTAL_FILESYSTEM 1
        #elif __has_include(<filesystem>)
            #define JSON_HAS_FILESYSTEM 1
        #elif __has_include(<experimental/filesystem>)
            #define JSON_HAS_EXPERIMENTAL_FILESYSTEM 1
        #endif

        // std::filesystem does not work on MinGW GCC 8: https://sourceforge.net/p/mingw-w64/bugs/737/
        #if defined(__MINGW32__) && defined(__GNUC__) && __GNUC__ == 8
            #undef JSON_HAS_FILESYSTEM
            #undef JSON_HAS_EXPERIMENTAL_FILESYSTEM
        #endif

        // no filesystem support before GCC 8: https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/compiler_support
        #if defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(__clang__) && __GNUC__ < 8
            #undef JSON_HAS_FILESYSTEM
            #undef JSON_HAS_EXPERIMENTAL_FILESYSTEM
        #endif

        // no filesystem support before Clang 7: https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/compiler_support
        #if defined(__clang_major__) && __clang_major__ < 7
            #undef JSON_HAS_FILESYSTEM
            #undef JSON_HAS_EXPERIMENTAL_FILESYSTEM
        #endif

        // no filesystem support before MSVC 19.14: https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/compiler_support
        #if defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER < 1914
            #undef JSON_HAS_FILESYSTEM
            #undef JSON_HAS_EXPERIMENTAL_FILESYSTEM
        #endif

        // no filesystem support before iOS 13
        #if defined(__IPHONE_OS_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED) && __IPHONE_OS_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED < 130000
            #undef JSON_HAS_FILESYSTEM
            #undef JSON_HAS_EXPERIMENTAL_FILESYSTEM
        #endif

        // no filesystem support before macOS Catalina
        #if defined(__MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED) && __MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED < 101500
            #undef JSON_HAS_FILESYSTEM
            #undef JSON_HAS_EXPERIMENTAL_FILESYSTEM
        #endif
    #endif
#endif

#ifndef JSON_HAS_EXPERIMENTAL_FILESYSTEM
    #define JSON_HAS_EXPERIMENTAL_FILESYSTEM 0
#endif

#ifndef JSON_HAS_FILESYSTEM
    #define JSON_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
#endif

#ifndef JSON_HAS_THREE_WAY_COMPARISON
    #if defined(__cpp_impl_three_way_comparison) && __cpp_impl_three_way_comparison >= 201907L \
        && defined(__cpp_lib_three_way_comparison) && __cpp_lib_three_way_comparison >= 201907L
        #define JSON_HAS_THREE_WAY_COMPARISON 1
    #else
        #define JSON_HAS_THREE_WAY_COMPARISON 0
    #endif
#endif

#ifndef JSON_HAS_RANGES
    // ranges header shipping in GCC 11.1.0 (released 2021-04-27) has syntax error
    #if defined(__GLIBCXX__) && __GLIBCXX__ == 20210427
        #define JSON_HAS_RANGES 0
    #elif defined(__cpp_lib_ranges)
        #define JSON_HAS_RANGES 1
    #else
        #define JSON_HAS_RANGES 0
    #endif
#endif

#ifndef JSON_HAS_STATIC_RTTI
    #if !defined(_HAS_STATIC_RTTI) || _HAS_STATIC_RTTI != 0
        #define JSON_HAS_STATIC_RTTI 1
    #else
        #define JSON_HAS_STATIC_RTTI 0
    #endif

#ifdef JSON_HAS_CPP_17

#else

#if JSON_HEDLEY_HAS_ATTRIBUTE(no_unique_address)
    #define JSON_NO_UNIQUE_ADDRESS [[no_unique_address]]
#else
    #define JSON_NO_UNIQUE_ADDRESS
#endif

// disable documentation warnings on clang
#if defined(__clang__)
    #pragma clang diagnostic push
    #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wdocumentation"
    #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wdocumentation-unknown-command"
#endif

// allow disabling exceptions
#if (defined(__cpp_exceptions) || defined(__EXCEPTIONS) || defined(_CPPUNWIND)) && !defined(JSON_NOEXCEPTION)
    #define JSON_THROW(exception) throw exception
    #define JSON_TRY try
    #define JSON_CATCH(exception) catch(exception)
    #define JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH(exception) catch(exception)
#else
    #include <cstdlib>
    #define JSON_THROW(exception) std::abort()
    #define JSON_TRY if(true)
    #define JSON_CATCH(exception) if(false)
    #define JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH(exception) if(false)
#endif

// override exception macros
#if defined(JSON_THROW_USER)
    #undef JSON_THROW
    #define JSON_THROW JSON_THROW_USER
#endif
#if defined(JSON_TRY_USER)
    #undef JSON_TRY
    #define JSON_TRY JSON_TRY_USER
#endif
#if defined(JSON_CATCH_USER)
    #undef JSON_CATCH
    #define JSON_CATCH JSON_CATCH_USER
    #undef JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH
    #define JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH JSON_CATCH_USER
#endif
#if defined(JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH_USER)
    #undef JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH
    #define JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH_USER
#endif

// allow overriding assert
#if !defined(JSON_ASSERT)
    #include <cassert> // assert
    #define JSON_ASSERT(x) assert(x)
#endif

// allow to access some private functions (needed by the test suite)
#if defined(JSON_TESTS_PRIVATE)
    #define JSON_PRIVATE_UNLESS_TESTED public
#else
    #define JSON_PRIVATE_UNLESS_TESTED private
#endif

/*!
@brief macro to briefly define a mapping between an enum and JSON
@def NLOHMANN_JSON_SERIALIZE_ENUM
@since version 3.4.0
*/
#define NLOHMANN_JSON_SERIALIZE_ENUM(ENUM_TYPE, ...)                                            \
    template<typename BasicJsonType>                                                            \
    inline void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const ENUM_TYPE& e)                                   \
    {                                                                                           \
        static_assert(std::is_enum<ENUM_TYPE>::value, #ENUM_TYPE " must be an enum!");          \
        static const std::pair<ENUM_TYPE, BasicJsonType> m[] = __VA_ARGS__;                     \
        auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(m), std::end(m),                                      \
                               [e](const std::pair<ENUM_TYPE, BasicJsonType>& ej_pair) -> bool  \
        {                                                                                       \
            return ej_pair.first == e;                                                          \
        });                                                                                     \
        j = ((it != std::end(m)) ? it : std::begin(m))->second;                                 \
    }                                                                                           \
    template<typename BasicJsonType>                                                            \
    inline void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, ENUM_TYPE& e)                                 \
    {                                                                                           \
        static_assert(std::is_enum<ENUM_TYPE>::value, #ENUM_TYPE " must be an enum!");          \
        static const std::pair<ENUM_TYPE, BasicJsonType> m[] = __VA_ARGS__;                     \
        auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(m), std::end(m),                                      \
                               [&j](const std::pair<ENUM_TYPE, BasicJsonType>& ej_pair) -> bool \
        {                                                                                       \
            return ej_pair.second == j;                                                         \
        });                                                                                     \
        e = ((it != std::end(m)) ? it : std::begin(m))->first;                                  \
    }

// Ugly macros to avoid uglier copy-paste when specializing basic_json. They
// may be removed in the future once the class is split.

             class NumberUnsignedType, class NumberFloatType,              \

             template<typename, typename = void> class JSONSerializer,     \
             class BinaryType,                                             \
             class CustomBaseClass>

#define NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL                                            \
    basic_json<ObjectType, ArrayType, StringType, BooleanType,             \

/*!
@brief macro
@def NLOHMANN_DEFINE_TYPE_INTRUSIVE
@since version 3.9.0
*/
#define NLOHMANN_DEFINE_TYPE_INTRUSIVE(Type, ...)  \
    friend void to_json(nlohmann::json& nlohmann_json_j, const Type& nlohmann_json_t) { NLOHMANN_JSON_EXPAND(NLOHMANN_JSON_PASTE(NLOHMANN_JSON_TO, __VA_ARGS__)) } \
    friend void from_json(const nlohmann::json& nlohmann_json_j, Type& nlohmann_json_t) { NLOHMANN_JSON_EXPAND(NLOHMANN_JSON_PASTE(NLOHMANN_JSON_FROM, __VA_ARGS__)) }

    friend void to_json(nlohmann::json& nlohmann_json_j, const Type& nlohmann_json_t) { NLOHMANN_JSON_EXPAND(NLOHMANN_JSON_PASTE(NLOHMANN_JSON_TO, __VA_ARGS__)) } \
    friend void from_json(const nlohmann::json& nlohmann_json_j, Type& nlohmann_json_t) { const Type nlohmann_json_default_obj{}; NLOHMANN_JSON_EXPAND(NLOHMANN_JSON_PASTE(NLOHMANN_JSON_FROM_WITH_DEFAULT, __VA_ARGS__)) }

// inspired from https://stackoverflow.com/a/26745591
// allows to call any std function as if (e.g. with begin):
// using std::begin; begin(x);
//
// it allows using the detected idiom to retrieve the return type
// of such an expression
#define NLOHMANN_CAN_CALL_STD_FUNC_IMPL(std_name)                                 \
    namespace detail {                                                            \
    using std::std_name;                                                          \
    \
    template<typename... T>                                                       \
    using result_of_##std_name = decltype(std_name(std::declval<T>()...));        \
    }                                                                             \
    \
    namespace detail2 {                                                           \
    struct std_name##_tag                                                         \
    {                                                                             \
    };                                                                            \
    \
    template<typename... T>                                                       \
    std_name##_tag std_name(T&&...);                                              \
    \
    template<typename... T>                                                       \
    using result_of_##std_name = decltype(std_name(std::declval<T>()...));        \
    \
    template<typename... T>                                                       \
    struct would_call_std_##std_name                                              \
    {                                                                             \
        static constexpr auto const value = ::nlohmann::detail::                  \
                                            is_detected_exact<std_name##_tag, result_of_##std_name, T...>::value; \
    };                                                                            \
    } /* namespace detail2 */ \
    \
    template<typename... T>                                                       \
    struct would_call_std_##std_name : detail2::would_call_std_##std_name<T...>   \
    {                                                                             \
    }

#ifndef JSON_USE_IMPLICIT_CONVERSIONS
    #define JSON_USE_IMPLICIT_CONVERSIONS 1
#endif

#if JSON_USE_IMPLICIT_CONVERSIONS
    #define JSON_EXPLICIT
#else
    #define JSON_EXPLICIT explicit
#endif

#ifndef JSON_DISABLE_ENUM_SERIALIZATION
    #define JSON_DISABLE_ENUM_SERIALIZATION 0
#endif

#ifndef JSON_USE_GLOBAL_UDLS
    #define JSON_USE_GLOBAL_UDLS 1
#endif

#if JSON_HAS_THREE_WAY_COMPARISON
    #include <compare> // partial_ordering
#endif

NLOHMANN_JSON_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
namespace detail
{

///////////////////////////
// JSON type enumeration //
///////////////////////////

/*!
@brief the JSON type enumeration

This enumeration collects the different JSON types. It is internally used to
distinguish the stored values, and the functions @ref basic_json::is_null(),
@ref basic_json::is_object(), @ref basic_json::is_array(),
@ref basic_json::is_string(), @ref basic_json::is_boolean(),
@ref basic_json::is_number() (with @ref basic_json::is_number_integer(),
@ref basic_json::is_number_unsigned(), and @ref basic_json::is_number_float()),
@ref basic_json::is_discarded(), @ref basic_json::is_primitive(), and
@ref basic_json::is_structured() rely on it.

@note There are three enumeration entries (number_integer, number_unsigned, and
number_float), because the library distinguishes these three types for numbers:
@ref basic_json::number_unsigned_t is used for unsigned integers,
@ref basic_json::number_integer_t is used for signed integers, and
@ref basic_json::number_float_t is used for floating-point numbers or to
approximate integers which do not fit in the limits of their respective type.

@sa see @ref basic_json::basic_json(const value_t value_type) -- create a JSON
value with the default value for a given type

@since version 1.0.0
*/
enum class value_t : std::uint8_t
{
    null,             ///< null value
    object,           ///< object (unordered set of name/value pairs)
    array,            ///< array (ordered collection of values)
    string,           ///< string value
    boolean,          ///< boolean value
    number_integer,   ///< number value (signed integer)
    number_unsigned,  ///< number value (unsigned integer)
    number_float,     ///< number value (floating-point)
    binary,           ///< binary array (ordered collection of bytes)
    discarded         ///< discarded by the parser callback function
};

/*!
@brief comparison operator for JSON types

Returns an ordering that is similar to Python:
- order: null < boolean < number < object < array < string < binary
- furthermore, each type is not smaller than itself
- discarded values are not comparable
- binary is represented as a b"" string in python and directly comparable to a
  string; however, making a binary array directly comparable with a string would
  be surprising behavior in a JSON file.

@since version 1.0.0
*/
#if JSON_HAS_THREE_WAY_COMPARISON
    inline std::partial_ordering operator<=>(const value_t lhs, const value_t rhs) noexcept // *NOPAD*
#else
    inline bool operator<(const value_t lhs, const value_t rhs) noexcept
#endif
{
    static constexpr std::array<std::uint8_t, 9> order = {{
            0 /* null */, 3 /* object */, 4 /* array */, 5 /* string */,
            1 /* boolean */, 2 /* integer */, 2 /* unsigned */, 2 /* float */,
            6 /* binary */
        }
    };

    const auto l_index = static_cast<std::size_t>(lhs);
    const auto r_index = static_cast<std::size_t>(rhs);
#if JSON_HAS_THREE_WAY_COMPARISON
    if (l_index < order.size() && r_index < order.size())
    {
        return order[l_index] <=> order[r_index]; // *NOPAD*
    }
    return std::partial_ordering::unordered;
#else
    return l_index < order.size() && r_index < order.size() && order[l_index] < order[r_index];
#endif
}

// GCC selects the built-in operator< over an operator rewritten from
// a user-defined spaceship operator
// Clang, MSVC, and ICC select the rewritten candidate
// (see GCC bug https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=105200)
#if JSON_HAS_THREE_WAY_COMPARISON && defined(__GNUC__)
inline bool operator<(const value_t lhs, const value_t rhs) noexcept
{
    return std::is_lt(lhs <=> rhs); // *NOPAD*
}
#endif

}  // namespace detail
NLOHMANN_JSON_NAMESPACE_END
